Appendix

Appendix A Main proofs

A.1 Proof of Proposition 1

See 1

Proof.

We first need to restrict the dynamics of (wλ⁢(t))superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡(w^{\lambda}(t))( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) to some compact of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Without loss of generality we can inflate the compact in Assumption 1, so that we can assume there is some compact K𝐾Kitalic_K of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for all t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0, B⁢(wGF⁢(t),1)⊂K𝐵superscript𝑤GF𝑡1𝐾B(w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t),1)\subset Kitalic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , 1 ) ⊂ italic_K, where B⁢(wGF⁢(t),1)𝐵superscript𝑤GF𝑡1B(w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t),1)italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , 1 ) is the ball of radius 1111 centered at wGF⁢(t)superscript𝑤GF𝑡w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ). We also define for any λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0, Tλ=inf{t∈ℝ+∣wλ⁢(t)∉K}subscript𝑇𝜆infimumconditional-set𝑡subscriptℝsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐾T_{\lambda}=\inf\{t\in\mathbb{R}_{+}\mid w^{\lambda}(t)\not\in K\}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_inf { italic_t ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∣ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∉ italic_K }.

Thanks to the continuity of ∇2Fsuperscript∇2𝐹\nabla^{2}F∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F, ∇F∇𝐹\nabla F∇ italic_F is c𝑐citalic_c-Lipschitz on K𝐾Kitalic_K, i.e.,

‖∇F⁢(w)−∇F⁢(w′)‖≤c⁢‖w−w′‖for any ⁢w,w′∈K.formulae-sequencenorm∇𝐹𝑤∇𝐹superscript𝑤′𝑐norm𝑤superscript𝑤′for any 𝑤superscript𝑤′𝐾\|\nabla F(w)-\nabla F(w^{\prime})\|\leq c\|w-w^{\prime}\|\qquad\text{for any % }w,w^{\prime}\in K.∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) - ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ ≤ italic_c ∥ italic_w - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ for any italic_w , italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ italic_K .

We then derive the following inequalities for all t∈[0,Tλ)𝑡0subscript𝑇𝜆t\in[0,T_{\lambda})italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ),

‖wλ⁢(t)−wG⁢F⁢(t)‖normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡\displaystyle\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ =‖∫0tw˙λ⁢(s)−w˙G⁢F⁢(s)⁢d⁢s‖absentnormsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡superscript˙𝑤𝜆𝑠superscript˙𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑠d𝑠\displaystyle=\left\|\int_{0}^{t}\dot{w}^{\lambda}(s)-\dot{w}^{GF}(s)\mathrm{d% }s\right\|= ∥ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over˙ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) - over˙ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) roman_d italic_s ∥
=‖∫0t∇F⁢(wG⁢F⁢(s))−∇F⁢(wλ⁢(s))−λ⁢wλ⁢(s)⁢d⁢s‖absentnormsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑠∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑠𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑠d𝑠\displaystyle=\left\|\int_{0}^{t}\nabla F(w^{GF}(s))-\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(s))-% \lambda w^{\lambda}(s)\mathrm{d}s\right\|= ∥ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - italic_λ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) roman_d italic_s ∥
≤∫0t‖∇F⁢(wG⁢F⁢(s))−∇F⁢(wλ⁢(s))‖⁢ds+λ⁢∫0t‖wλ⁢(s)‖⁢dsabsentsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡norm∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑠∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑠differential-d𝑠𝜆superscriptsubscript0𝑡normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑠differential-d𝑠\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{t}\left\|\nabla F(w^{GF}(s))-\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(s% ))\right\|\mathrm{d}s+\lambda\int_{0}^{t}\|w^{\lambda}(s)\|\mathrm{d}s≤ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) ∥ roman_d italic_s + italic_λ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ∥ roman_d italic_s
≤c⁢∫0t‖wλ⁢(s)−wG⁢F⁢(s)‖⁢ds+λ⁢t⁢supw∈K‖w‖.absent𝑐superscriptsubscript0𝑡normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑠superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑠differential-d𝑠𝜆𝑡subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤\displaystyle\leq c\int_{0}^{t}\left\|w^{\lambda}(s)-w^{GF}(s)\right\|\mathrm{% d}s+\lambda t\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|.≤ italic_c ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ∥ roman_d italic_s + italic_λ italic_t roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ .

The integral form of Grönwall inequality111The more classical form of Grönwall inequality cannot be directly used here, since ‖wλ⁢(t)−wG⁢F⁢(t)‖normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ might be non-differentiable at some points. – also called Grönwall-Bellman inequality – then leads to the following inequality for any t∈[0,Tλ)𝑡0subscript𝑇𝜆t\in[0,T_{\lambda})italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ):

‖wλ⁢(t)−wG⁢F⁢(t)‖≤λ⁢t⁢ec⁢t⁢supw∈K‖w‖.normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡𝜆𝑡superscript𝑒𝑐𝑡subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|\leq\lambda te^{ct}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|.∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ ≤ italic_λ italic_t italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ . (9)

In particular for a fixed T∈ℝ+𝑇subscriptℝT\in\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_T ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, there is a λ⋆>0superscript𝜆⋆0\lambda^{\star}>0italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 small enough such that for any λ≤λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_λ ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT,

∀t∈[0,T],λ⁢t⁢ec⁢t⁢supw∈K‖w‖<1.formulae-sequencefor-all𝑡0𝑇𝜆𝑡superscript𝑒𝑐𝑡subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤1\forall t\in[0,T],\lambda te^{ct}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|<1.∀ italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ] , italic_λ italic_t italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ < 1 .

Given the definition of Tλsubscript𝑇𝜆T_{\lambda}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, Equation 9 and the fact that ⋃t∈ℝ+B⁢(wGF⁢(t),1)⊂Ksubscript𝑡subscriptℝ𝐵superscript𝑤GF𝑡1𝐾\bigcup_{t\in\mathbb{R}_{+}}B(w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t),1)\subset K⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , 1 ) ⊂ italic_K, this then implies that for any λ≤λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_λ ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Tλ>Tsubscript𝑇𝜆𝑇T_{\lambda}>Titalic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_T. In particular, for any λ≤λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_λ ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, Equation 9 becomes

supt∈[0,T]‖wλ⁢(t)−wG⁢F⁢(t)‖≤λ⁢T⁢ec⁢T⁢supw∈K‖w‖.subscriptsupremum𝑡0𝑇normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡𝜆𝑇superscript𝑒𝑐𝑇subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤\sup_{t\in[0,T]}\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|\leq\lambda Te^{cT}\sup% _{w\in K}\|w\|.roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ ≤ italic_λ italic_T italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ .

Proposition 1 then directly follows. ∎

A.2 Junction between fast and slow dynamics

In the limit λ→0→𝜆0\lambda\to 0italic_λ → 0, the whole fast dynamics described by Proposition 1 is crushed into the t=0𝑡0t=0italic_t = 0 point of the slow timescale. While Sections 4.1 and 4.2 respectively provide descriptions of the fast and slow timescale dynamics, one needs to control the junction of these two dynamics. This junction is made possible by Lemma 2 below, as well as a timeshift argument in the proof of Proposition 2.

Lemma 2.

If Assumption 1 holds, there exists a function t⁢(λ)𝑡𝜆t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_λ ) such that limλ→0t⁢(λ)=0subscript→𝜆0𝑡𝜆0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}t(\lambda)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ( italic_λ ) = 0 and

limλ→0w~λ⁢(t⁢(λ))=limt→∞wGF⁢(t).subscript→𝜆0superscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤GF𝑡\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t(\lambda))=\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\mathrm% {GF}}(t).roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) = roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) .

Lemma 2 states that for a well chosen timepoint t⁢(λ)𝑡𝜆t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_λ ), which is of order −λ⁢ln⁡(λ)𝜆𝜆-\lambda\ln(\lambda)- italic_λ roman_ln ( italic_λ ), the slow dynamics solution w~λsuperscript~𝑤𝜆\tilde{w}^{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT will be close to the limit of the unregularised flow at that timepoint. This result will then be key in showing that limλ→0w~λsubscript→𝜆0superscript~𝑤𝜆\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\tilde{w}^{\lambda}roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT admits a right limit in 00, which is given by limt→∞wGF⁢(t)subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤GF𝑡\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\mathrm{GF}}(t)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ).

Note that this order −λ⁢ln⁡(λ)𝜆𝜆-\lambda\ln(\lambda)- italic_λ roman_ln ( italic_λ ) for t⁢(λ)𝑡𝜆t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_λ ) is necessary: a smaller value of t⁢(λ)𝑡𝜆t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_λ ) would not allow enough time for the flow to approach the limit of the unregularised gradient flow; while a larger value would correspond to a time where the regularised flow significantly drifted from the unregularised one.

This time −λ⁢ln⁡(λ)𝜆𝜆-\lambda\ln(\lambda)- italic_λ roman_ln ( italic_λ ) can indeed be seen, in the fast timescale, as the point where the dynamics transition from mimicking the unregularised flow, to the slow dynamics that minimises the regularisation term within some manifold.

Proof.

Equation 9 in the proof of Proposition 1 yields that for any t∈[0,Tλ]𝑡0subscript𝑇𝜆t\in[0,T_{\lambda}]italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], ‖wλ⁢(t)−wG⁢F⁢(t)‖≤λ⁢t⁢ec⁢t⁢supw∈K‖w‖normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡𝜆𝑡superscript𝑒𝑐𝑡subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\right\|\leq\lambda te^{ct}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ ≤ italic_λ italic_t italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥. We can then define t⁢(λ)=−λ⁢ln⁡λ2⁢c>0𝑡𝜆𝜆𝜆2𝑐0t(\lambda)=\frac{-\lambda\ln\lambda}{2c}>0italic_t ( italic_λ ) = divide start_ARG - italic_λ roman_ln italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG > 0 and observe that for any t≤min⁡(Tλ,t⁢(λ)λ)𝑡subscript𝑇𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆t\leq\min(T_{\lambda},\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})italic_t ≤ roman_min ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ),

‖wλ⁢(t)−wG⁢F⁢(t)‖normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡\displaystyle\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{GF}(t)\|∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ ≤t⁢(λ)⁢ec⁢t⁢(λ)λ⁢supw∈K‖w‖absent𝑡𝜆superscript𝑒𝑐𝑡𝜆𝜆subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤\displaystyle\leq t(\lambda)e^{c\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|≤ italic_t ( italic_λ ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥
=−λ⁢ln⁡(λ)2⁢c⁢supw∈K‖w‖.absent𝜆𝜆2𝑐subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤\displaystyle=\frac{-\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)}{2c}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|.= divide start_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ .

Since λ⁢ln⁡(λ)⁢⟶λ→0⁢0𝜆𝜆→𝜆0⟶0\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)\underset{\lambda\to 0}{\longrightarrow}0square-root start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_λ ) start_UNDERACCENT italic_λ → 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG ⟶ end_ARG 0, we have for λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ small enough that the above term is smaller than 1111. In particular for λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ small enough, Tλ≥t⁢(λ)λsubscript𝑇𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆T_{\lambda}\geq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG. From there, Equation 9 yields at t⁢(λ)λ𝑡𝜆𝜆\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG for any small enough λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0

‖w~λ⁢(t⁢(λ))−limt→∞wG⁢F⁢(t)‖normsuperscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡\displaystyle\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t(\lambda))-\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{GF}(t)\|∥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) - roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ ≤‖w~λ⁢(t⁢(λ))−wG⁢F⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)‖+‖wG⁢F⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)−limt→∞wG⁢F⁢(t)‖absentnormsuperscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡𝜆𝜆normsuperscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡𝜆𝜆subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡\displaystyle\leq\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t(\lambda))-w^{GF}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{% \lambda})\|+\|w^{GF}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})-\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{GF}(t)\|≤ ∥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ∥ + ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) - roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥
≤−λ⁢ln⁡(λ)2⁢c⁢supw∈K‖w‖+‖wG⁢F⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)−limt→∞wG⁢F⁢(t)‖.absent𝜆𝜆2𝑐subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾norm𝑤normsuperscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡𝜆𝜆subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝐺𝐹𝑡\displaystyle\leq\frac{-\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)}{2c}\sup_{w\in K}\|w\|+\|w^% {GF}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})-\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{GF}(t)\|.≤ divide start_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ + ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) - roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_G italic_F end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ .

Now note that our choice of t⁢(λ)𝑡𝜆t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_λ ) is such that both the first and second term in the last inequality converge to 00 — indeed, t⁢(λ)⁢ec⁢t⁢(λ)λ=−λ⁢ln⁡(λ)2⁢c⁢⟶λ→0⁢0𝑡𝜆superscript𝑒𝑐𝑡𝜆𝜆𝜆𝜆2𝑐→𝜆0⟶0t(\lambda)e^{c\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}=\frac{-\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda)}{2% c}\underset{\lambda\to 0}{\longrightarrow}0italic_t ( italic_λ ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_c end_ARG start_UNDERACCENT italic_λ → 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG ⟶ end_ARG 0 and t⁢(λ)λ⁢⟶λ→0+∞𝑡𝜆𝜆→𝜆0⟶\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}\underset{\lambda\to 0}{\longrightarrow}+\inftydivide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_UNDERACCENT italic_λ → 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG ⟶ end_ARG + ∞ — which concludes the proof. ∎

A.3 Proof of Proposition 2

The main element to prove Proposition 2 is Lemma 4 below. We first need to state another auxiliary lemma, given by Lemma 3 below, and proven in Section B.5.

Lemma 3.

Consider Assumptions 1 and 2. Let (uλ)λ>0subscriptsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝜆0(u^{\lambda})_{\lambda>0}( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a family of solutions of the following ODE for any λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0 and t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0,

u˙λ⁢(t)=−uλ⁢(t)−1λ⁢∇F⁢(uλ⁢(t)).superscript˙𝑢𝜆𝑡superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡1𝜆∇𝐹superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡\dot{u}^{\lambda}(t)=-u^{\lambda}(t)-\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F(u^{\lambda}(t)).over˙ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = - italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) .

If also uλ⁢(0)→u0∈ℳ→superscript𝑢𝜆0subscript𝑢0ℳu^{\lambda}(0)\to u_{0}\in\mathcal{M}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) → italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_M, then there exists a neighbourhood U𝑈Uitalic_U of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M such that ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ is 𝒞2superscript𝒞2\mathcal{C}^{2}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on U𝑈Uitalic_U and for every ε>0𝜀0\varepsilon>0italic_ε > 0, there exists a family of neighbourhoods (Uε)ε>0subscriptsubscript𝑈𝜀𝜀0(U_{\varepsilon})_{\varepsilon>0}( italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M such that

  1. 1.

    Uε⊆Uε′⊂Usubscript𝑈𝜀subscript𝑈superscript𝜀′𝑈U_{\varepsilon}\subseteq U_{\varepsilon^{\prime}}\subset Uitalic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊂ italic_U for any ε<ε′𝜀superscript𝜀′\varepsilon<\varepsilon^{\prime}italic_ε < italic_ε start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT;

  2. 2.

    there exists λ⁢(ε)>0𝜆𝜀0\lambda(\varepsilon)>0italic_λ ( italic_ε ) > 0 such that for any λ≤λ⁢(ε)𝜆𝜆𝜀\lambda\leq\lambda(\varepsilon)italic_λ ≤ italic_λ ( italic_ε ), the trajectory (uλ⁢(t))t≥0subscriptsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝑡0(u^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ≥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is contained in Uεsubscript𝑈𝜀U_{\varepsilon}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT;

  3. 3.

    ⋂ε>0Uε=ℳsubscript𝜀0subscript𝑈𝜀ℳ\bigcap_{\varepsilon>0}U_{\varepsilon}=\mathcal{M}⋂ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_M.

Note that the existence of a neighbourhood U𝑈Uitalic_U in Lemma 3 is guaranteed by Lemma 1. We can now state our key lemma.

Lemma 4.

Consider Assumptions 1 and 2. Let (uλ)λ>0subscriptsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝜆0(u^{\lambda})_{\lambda>0}( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a family of solutions of the following ODE for any λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0 and t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0,

u˙λ⁢(t)=−uλ⁢(t)−1λ⁢∇F⁢(uλ⁢(t)).superscript˙𝑢𝜆𝑡superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡1𝜆∇𝐹superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡\dot{u}^{\lambda}(t)=-u^{\lambda}(t)-\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F(u^{\lambda}(t)).over˙ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = - italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) .

If also uλ⁢(0)→u0∈ℳ→superscript𝑢𝜆0subscript𝑢0ℳu^{\lambda}(0)\to u_{0}\in\mathcal{M}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) → italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_M, then uλsuperscript𝑢𝜆u^{\lambda}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT converges uniformly, as λ→0→𝜆0\lambda\to 0italic_λ → 0, on any interval of the form [0,T]0𝑇[0,T][ 0 , italic_T ] to the function u𝑢uitalic_u defined as the solution of the following ODE:

u⁢(0)=u0𝑢0subscript𝑢0\displaystyle u(0)=u_{0}italic_u ( 0 ) = italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
u˙⁢(t)=−D⁢Φu⁢(t)⁢(u⁢(t)).˙𝑢𝑡𝐷subscriptΦ𝑢𝑡𝑢𝑡\displaystyle\dot{u}(t)=-D\Phi_{u(t)}(u(t)).over˙ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG ( italic_t ) = - italic_D roman_Φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u ( italic_t ) ) .
Proof.

First consider a neighbourhood U𝑈Uitalic_U of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M such that ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ is 𝒞2superscript𝒞2\mathcal{C}^{2}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on U𝑈Uitalic_U and Lemma 3 holds. From there thanks to Lemma 3, we can assume that λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0 is chosen small enough so that uλ⁢(t)∈Usuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝑈u^{\lambda}(t)\in Uitalic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_U for any t∈ℝ+𝑡subscriptℝt\in\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_t ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We can now compute the time derivative of Φ⁢(uλ⁢(t))Φsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡\Phi(u^{\lambda}(t))roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ), using the chain rule for any t∈ℝ+𝑡subscriptℝt\in\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_t ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ small enough:

Φ˙⁢(uλ⁢(t))=−D⁢Φuλ⁢(t)⋅(uλ⁢(t)+1λ⁢∇F⁢(uλ⁢(t))).˙Φsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡⋅𝐷subscriptΦsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡1𝜆∇𝐹superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡\dot{\Phi}(u^{\lambda}(t))=-D\Phi_{u^{\lambda}(t)}\cdot\left(u^{\lambda}(t)+% \frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F(u^{\lambda}(t))\right).over˙ start_ARG roman_Φ end_ARG ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) = - italic_D roman_Φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ) .

Then using the fact that for any w∈U𝑤𝑈w\in Uitalic_w ∈ italic_U, D⁢Φ⁢(w)⋅∇F⁢(w)=0⋅𝐷Φ𝑤∇𝐹𝑤0D\Phi(w)\cdot\nabla F(w)=0italic_D roman_Φ ( italic_w ) ⋅ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) = 0 [Li et al., 2021, Lemma C.2],

Φ˙⁢(uλ⁢(t))˙Φsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡\displaystyle\dot{\Phi}(u^{\lambda}(t))over˙ start_ARG roman_Φ end_ARG ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) =−D⁢Φuλ⁢(t)⋅uλ⁢(t).absent⋅𝐷subscriptΦsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡\displaystyle=-D\Phi_{u^{\lambda}(t)}\cdot u^{\lambda}(t).= - italic_D roman_Φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) . (10)

It now remains to show that uλ⁢(t)→ℳ→superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡ℳu^{\lambda}(t)\to\mathcal{M}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) → caligraphic_M as λ→0→𝜆0\lambda\to 0italic_λ → 0, to guarantee that Φ⁢(uλ⁢(t))Φsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡\Phi(u^{\lambda}(t))roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) and uλ⁢(t)superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡u^{\lambda}(t)italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) have the same limit, which will be done using Lemma 3.

Thanks to Lemma 3, we can consider a family of neighbourhoods (Uε)ε>0subscriptsubscript𝑈𝜀𝜀0(U_{\varepsilon})_{\varepsilon>0}( italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and a function λ:ℝ+∗→ℝ+∗:𝜆→superscriptsubscriptℝsuperscriptsubscriptℝ\lambda:\mathbb{R}_{+}^{*}\to\mathbb{R}_{+}^{*}italic_λ : blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT satisfying Lemma 3. As we can always take a smaller choice for any value λ⁢(ε)𝜆𝜀\lambda(\varepsilon)italic_λ ( italic_ε ), we can also choose the function λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ so that

  • •

    it is non-decreasing;

  • •

    limε→0λ⁢(ε)=0subscript→𝜀0𝜆𝜀0\lim_{\varepsilon\to 0}\lambda(\varepsilon)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ ( italic_ε ) = 0.

For the remaining of proof, define the function H:w↦−D⁢Φw⋅w:𝐻maps-to𝑤⋅𝐷subscriptΦ𝑤𝑤H:w\mapsto-D\Phi_{w}\cdot witalic_H : italic_w ↦ - italic_D roman_Φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⋅ italic_w and take ε⁢(λ)=inf{ε>0∣λ≤λ⁢(ε)}𝜀𝜆infimumconditional-set𝜀0𝜆𝜆𝜀\varepsilon(\lambda)=\inf\{\varepsilon>0\mid\lambda\leq\lambda(\varepsilon)\}italic_ε ( italic_λ ) = roman_inf { italic_ε > 0 ∣ italic_λ ≤ italic_λ ( italic_ε ) }. We consider in the following λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ small enough so that ε⁢(λ)𝜀𝜆\varepsilon(\lambda)italic_ε ( italic_λ ) is defined and finite. Since limε→0λ⁢(ε)=0subscript→𝜀0𝜆𝜀0\lim_{\varepsilon\to 0}\lambda(\varepsilon)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ ( italic_ε ) = 0, ε⁢(λ)>0𝜀𝜆0\varepsilon(\lambda)>0italic_ε ( italic_λ ) > 0 for any λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0. The function ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε is non-increasing, so it admits a limit at 00. Moreover for any δ>0𝛿0\delta>0italic_δ > 0, ε⁢(λ⁢(δ))≤δ𝜀𝜆𝛿𝛿\varepsilon(\lambda(\delta))\leq\deltaitalic_ε ( italic_λ ( italic_δ ) ) ≤ italic_δ by definition, sot that limλ→0ε⁢(λ)=0subscript→𝜆0𝜀𝜆0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\varepsilon(\lambda)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε ( italic_λ ) = 0.

Thanks to Lemma 3, (uλ⁢(t))t≥0subscriptsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝑡0(u^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ≥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is contained in Uε⁢(λ)subscript𝑈𝜀𝜆U_{\varepsilon(\lambda)}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε ( italic_λ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. By monotonicity of ‖w~∘‖2subscriptnormsuperscript~𝑤2\|\tilde{w}^{\circ}\|_{2}∥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the trajectory (w~∘⁢(t))t≥0subscriptsuperscript~𝑤𝑡𝑡0(\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t))_{t\geq 0}( over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ≥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is bounded. Moreover, the trajectory of w~λ⁢(t)superscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t)over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is also bounded independently of λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ thanks to Lemma 7. We can thus consider a compact K𝐾Kitalic_K of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0 and λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0, w~∘⁢(t)∈Ksuperscript~𝑤𝑡𝐾\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)\in Kover~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_K and w~λ⁢(t)∈Ksuperscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐾\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t)\in Kover~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_K.

Recall that ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ is the identity function on ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and is 𝒞2superscript𝒞2\mathcal{C}^{2}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on U𝑈Uitalic_U. In consequence, we have222This is a direct consequence of Taylor’s expansion taken at the euclidean projection of w𝑤witalic_w on ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and the fact that limλ→0ε⁢(λ)=0subscript→𝜆0𝜀𝜆0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\varepsilon(\lambda)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε ( italic_λ ) = 0. supw∈K∩Uε⁢(λ)‖Φ⁢(w)−w‖2⁢⟶λ→0⁢0subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾subscript𝑈𝜀𝜆subscriptnormΦ𝑤𝑤2→𝜆0⟶0\sup_{w\in K\cap U_{\varepsilon(\lambda)}}\|\Phi(w)-w\|_{2}\underset{\lambda% \to 0}{\longrightarrow}0roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K ∩ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε ( italic_λ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_w ) - italic_w ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_λ → 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG ⟶ end_ARG 0.

Summing over Equation 10 yields for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0:

uλ⁢(t)=∫0tH⁢(uλ⁢(s))⁢ds+uλ⁢(t)−Φ⁢(uλ⁢(t))+Φ⁢(uλ⁢(0)).superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡𝐻superscript𝑢𝜆𝑠differential-d𝑠superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡Φsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡Φsuperscript𝑢𝜆0\displaystyle u^{\lambda}(t)=\int_{0}^{t}H(u^{\lambda}(s))\mathrm{d}s+u^{% \lambda}(t)-\Phi(u^{\lambda}(t))+\Phi(u^{\lambda}(0)).italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) roman_d italic_s + italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) + roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) .

Since ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ is 𝒞2superscript𝒞2\mathcal{C}^{2}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on U𝑈Uitalic_U, H𝐻Hitalic_H is c𝑐citalic_c-Lipschitz on K𝐾Kitalic_K, for some c>0𝑐0c>0italic_c > 0. A comparison with u𝑢uitalic_u then yields for any 0≤t≤Tλ0𝑡subscript𝑇𝜆0\leq t\leq T_{\lambda}0 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

‖uλ⁢(t)−u⁢(t)‖normsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝑢𝑡\displaystyle\|u^{\lambda}(t)-u(t)\|∥ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_u ( italic_t ) ∥ ≤∫0t‖H⁢(uλ⁢(s))−H⁢(u⁢(s))‖⁢ds+‖uλ⁢(t)−Φ⁢(uλ⁢(t))‖+‖Φ⁢(uλ⁢(0))−u0‖absentsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡norm𝐻superscript𝑢𝜆𝑠𝐻𝑢𝑠differential-d𝑠normsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡Φsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡normΦsuperscript𝑢𝜆0subscript𝑢0\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{t}\|H(u^{\lambda}(s))-H(u(s))\|\mathrm{d}s+\|u^{% \lambda}(t)-\Phi(u^{\lambda}(t))\|+\|\Phi(u^{\lambda}(0))-u_{0}\|≤ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_H ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - italic_H ( italic_u ( italic_s ) ) ∥ roman_d italic_s + ∥ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ∥ + ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) - italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥
≤c⁢∫0t‖uλ⁢(s)−u⁢(s)‖⁢ds+supw∈K∩Uε⁢(λ)‖Φ⁢(w)−w‖+‖Φ⁢(uλ⁢(0))−u0‖.absent𝑐superscriptsubscript0𝑡normsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑠𝑢𝑠differential-d𝑠subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾subscript𝑈𝜀𝜆normΦ𝑤𝑤normΦsuperscript𝑢𝜆0subscript𝑢0\displaystyle\leq c\int_{0}^{t}\|u^{\lambda}(s)-u(s)\|\mathrm{d}s+\sup_{w\in K% \cap U_{\varepsilon(\lambda)}}\|\Phi(w)-w\|+\|\Phi(u^{\lambda}(0))-u_{0}\|.≤ italic_c ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) - italic_u ( italic_s ) ∥ roman_d italic_s + roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K ∩ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε ( italic_λ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_w ) - italic_w ∥ + ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) - italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ .

Similarly to the proof of Proposition 1, an integral form of Grönwall inequality yields for any t∈[0,Tλ)𝑡0subscript𝑇𝜆t\in[0,T_{\lambda})italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

‖uλ⁢(t)−u⁢(t)‖≤(supw∈K∩Uε⁢(λ)‖Φ⁢(w)−w‖+‖Φ⁢(uλ⁢(0))−u0‖)⁢ec⁢t.normsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝑢𝑡subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾subscript𝑈𝜀𝜆normΦ𝑤𝑤normΦsuperscript𝑢𝜆0subscript𝑢0superscript𝑒𝑐𝑡\displaystyle\|u^{\lambda}(t)-u(t)\|\leq\left(\sup_{w\in K\cap U_{\varepsilon(% \lambda)}}\|\Phi(w)-w\|+\|\Phi(u^{\lambda}(0))-u_{0}\|\right)e^{ct}.∥ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_u ( italic_t ) ∥ ≤ ( roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K ∩ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε ( italic_λ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_w ) - italic_w ∥ + ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) - italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (11)

Noting that the multiplicative term supw∈K∩Uε⁢(λ)‖Φ⁢(w)−w‖+‖Φ⁢(uλ⁢(0))−u0‖subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐾subscript𝑈𝜀𝜆normΦ𝑤𝑤normΦsuperscript𝑢𝜆0subscript𝑢0\sup_{w\in K\cap U_{\varepsilon(\lambda)}}\|\Phi(w)-w\|+\|\Phi(u^{\lambda}(0))% -u_{0}\|roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_K ∩ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε ( italic_λ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_w ) - italic_w ∥ + ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) - italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ goes to 00 as λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ goes to 00 allows to conclude on the uniform convergence of uλsuperscript𝑢𝜆u^{\lambda}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to u𝑢uitalic_u on [0,T]0𝑇[0,T][ 0 , italic_T ]. ∎

See 2

Proof.

Consider the shifted slow dynamics v~λsuperscript~𝑣𝜆\tilde{v}^{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0 as v~λ⁢(t)=w~λ⁢(t+t⁢(λ))superscript~𝑣𝜆𝑡superscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡𝑡𝜆\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(t)=\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t+t(\lambda))over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t + italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) with t⁢(λ)𝑡𝜆t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_λ ) given by Lemma 2. Using Lemma 2, v~λsuperscript~𝑣𝜆\tilde{v}^{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT then follows the following ODE:

v~˙λ⁢(t)=−v~λ⁢(t)−1λ⁢∇F⁢(v~λ⁢(t)),superscript˙~𝑣𝜆𝑡superscript~𝑣𝜆𝑡1𝜆∇𝐹superscript~𝑣𝜆𝑡\dot{\tilde{v}}^{\lambda}(t)=-\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(t)-\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F% (\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(t)),over˙ start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = - over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ,

with an initial condition satisfying limλ→0v~λ⁢(0)=Φ⁢(w0)subscript→𝜆0superscript~𝑣𝜆0Φsubscript𝑤0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(0)=\Phi(w_{0})roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) = roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

We can then direct apply Lemma 4 above on v~λsuperscript~𝑣𝜆\tilde{v}^{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which yields that v~λsuperscript~𝑣𝜆\tilde{v}^{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT converges uniformly on any interval of the form [0,T]0𝑇[0,T][ 0 , italic_T ] to w~∘superscript~𝑤\tilde{w}^{\circ}over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Proposition 2 is then obtained by observing that limλ→0t⁢(λ)=0subscript→𝜆0𝑡𝜆0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}t(\lambda)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ( italic_λ ) = 0, so that for any ε>0𝜀0\varepsilon>0italic_ε > 0 and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ small enough such that t⁢(λ)≤ε𝑡𝜆𝜀t(\lambda)\leq\varepsilonitalic_t ( italic_λ ) ≤ italic_ε, it holds for any t∈[ε,T]𝑡𝜀𝑇t\in[\varepsilon,T]italic_t ∈ [ italic_ε , italic_T ]

‖w~λ⁢(t)−w~∘⁢(t)‖normsuperscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript~𝑤𝑡\displaystyle\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t)-\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)\|∥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ =‖v~λ⁢(t−t⁢(λ))−w~∘⁢(t)‖absentnormsuperscript~𝑣𝜆𝑡𝑡𝜆superscript~𝑤𝑡\displaystyle=\|\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(t-t(\lambda))-\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)\|= ∥ over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) - over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥
≤‖v~λ⁢(t−t⁢(λ))−w~∘⁢(t−t⁢(λ))‖+‖w~∘⁢(t)−w~∘⁢(t−t⁢(λ))‖.absentnormsuperscript~𝑣𝜆𝑡𝑡𝜆superscript~𝑤𝑡𝑡𝜆normsuperscript~𝑤𝑡superscript~𝑤𝑡𝑡𝜆\displaystyle\leq\|\tilde{v}^{\lambda}(t-t(\lambda))-\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t-t(% \lambda))\|+\|\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)-\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t-t(\lambda))\|.≤ ∥ over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) - over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) ∥ + ∥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t - italic_t ( italic_λ ) ) ∥ .

The first term converges to 00 uniformly for t∈[ε,T]𝑡𝜀𝑇t\in[\varepsilon,T]italic_t ∈ [ italic_ε , italic_T ] by uniform convergence of v~λsuperscript~𝑣𝜆\tilde{v}^{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT towards w~∘superscript~𝑤\tilde{w}^{\circ}over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT; and the second term also goes uniformly to 00 by (uniform) continuity of w~∘superscript~𝑤\tilde{w}^{\circ}over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on the considered interval. ∎

A.4 Proof of Proposition 3

See 3

Proof.

By definition [see e.g., Bergmann and Herzog, 2019], the KKT points of Equation 7 are the points w⋆∈ℳsuperscript𝑤⋆ℳw^{\star}\in\mathcal{M}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_M satisfying

gradℳ⁢ℓ2⁢(w⋆)=0.subscriptgradℳsubscriptℓ2superscript𝑤⋆0\mathrm{grad}_{\mathcal{M}}\ell_{2}(w^{\star})=0.roman_grad start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = 0 .

Since gradℳ⁢ℓ2=PKer⁢(∇2F⁢(w⋆))subscriptgradℳsubscriptℓ2subscript𝑃Kersuperscript∇2𝐹superscript𝑤⋆\mathrm{grad}_{\mathcal{M}}\ell_{2}=P_{\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star}))}roman_grad start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ker ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, KKT points of Equation 7 are the points w⋆∈ℳsuperscript𝑤⋆ℳw^{\star}\in\mathcal{M}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_M satisfying

w⋆∈Ker⁢(∇2F⁢(w⋆))⟂.superscript𝑤⋆Kersuperscriptsuperscript∇2𝐹superscript𝑤⋆perpendicular-tow^{\star}\in\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star}))^{\perp}.italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ roman_Ker ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟂ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (12)

Thanks to Lemma 7, the trajectories (wλ⁢(t))t≥0subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝑡0(w^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ≥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are all bounded and w∞λ≔limt→∞wλ⁢(t)≔subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡w^{\lambda}_{\infty}\coloneqq\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≔ roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) exists for any λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0. In particular, this limit is a stationary point of the regularised loss Fλsubscript𝐹𝜆F_{\lambda}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, i.e.,

∇F⁢(w∞λ)+λ⁢w∞λ=0.∇𝐹subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝜆subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆0\nabla F(w^{\lambda}_{\infty})+\lambda w^{\lambda}_{\infty}=0.∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_λ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 .

In particular, w∞λ=−1λ⁢∇F⁢(w∞λ)subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆1𝜆∇𝐹subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆w^{\lambda}_{\infty}=-\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F(w^{\lambda}_{\infty})italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

Let (λk)k∈ℕsubscriptsubscript𝜆𝑘𝑘ℕ(\lambda_{k})_{k\in\mathbb{N}}( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k ∈ blackboard_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a sequence in ℝ+∗superscriptsubscriptℝ\mathbb{R}_{+}^{*}blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that λk⁢⟶k→∞⁢0subscript𝜆𝑘→𝑘⟶0\lambda_{k}\underset{k\to\infty}{\longrightarrow}0italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_k → ∞ end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG ⟶ end_ARG 0. Let w⋆superscript𝑤⋆w^{\star}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be an adherence point of the sequence (w∞λk)ksubscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘𝑘(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty})_{k}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thanks to Lemma 3, w⋆∈ℳsuperscript𝑤⋆ℳw^{\star}\in\mathcal{M}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_M. Moreover, the equality w∞λk=−1λk⁢∇F⁢(w∞λk)subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘1subscript𝜆𝑘∇𝐹subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}=-\frac{1}{\lambda_{k}}\nabla F(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{% \infty})italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) first implies that ‖∇F⁢(w∞λk)‖=𝒪⁢(λk)norm∇𝐹subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘𝒪subscript𝜆𝑘\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty})\|=\mathcal{O}\left(\lambda_{k}\right)∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ = caligraphic_O ( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Rebjock and Boumal [2024, Proposition 2.8] then also implies that

d⁢(w∞λk,ℳ)=𝒪⁢(λk).𝑑subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘ℳ𝒪subscript𝜆𝑘d(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty},\mathcal{M})=\mathcal{O}\left(\lambda_{k}\right).italic_d ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_M ) = caligraphic_O ( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Moreover, noting wk=arg⁢minw∈ℳ⁢‖w∞λk−w‖subscript𝑤𝑘argsubscriptmin𝑤ℳnormsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘𝑤w_{k}=\mathrm{arg\ min\ }_{w\in\mathcal{M}}\|w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}-w\|italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w ∥ the projection of w∞λksubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT onto ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M, a Taylor expansion yields

1λ⁢∇F⁢(w∞λk)1𝜆∇𝐹subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘\displaystyle\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty})divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =1λ⁢∇F⁢(wk)+1λ⁢∇2F⁢(wk)⊤⁢(w∞λk−wk)+o⁢(‖wλk−wk‖λk)absent1𝜆∇𝐹subscript𝑤𝑘1𝜆superscript∇2𝐹superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘topsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘subscript𝑤𝑘𝑜normsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘subscript𝑤𝑘subscript𝜆𝑘\displaystyle=\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla F(w_{k})+\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla^{2}F(w_% {k})^{\top}(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}-w_{k})+o(\frac{\|w^{\lambda_{k}}-w_{k}\|}% {\lambda_{k}})= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( divide start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG )
=1λ⁢∇2F⁢(wk)⊤⁢(w∞λk−wk)+o⁢(d⁢(w∞λk,ℳ)λk)absent1𝜆superscript∇2𝐹superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘topsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘subscript𝑤𝑘𝑜𝑑subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘ℳsubscript𝜆𝑘\displaystyle=\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla^{2}F(w_{k})^{\top}(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{% \infty}-w_{k})+o(\frac{d(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty},\mathcal{M})}{\lambda_{k}})= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( divide start_ARG italic_d ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_M ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG )
=1λ⁢∇2F⁢(wk)⊤⁢(w∞λk−wk)+o⁢(1).absent1𝜆superscript∇2𝐹superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘topsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘subscript𝑤𝑘𝑜1\displaystyle=\frac{1}{\lambda}\nabla^{2}F(w_{k})^{\top}(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{% \infty}-w_{k})+o(1).= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( 1 ) .

The equality w∞λk=−1λk⁢∇F⁢(w∞λk)subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘1subscript𝜆𝑘∇𝐹subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}=-\frac{1}{\lambda_{k}}\nabla F(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{% \infty})italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) then implies that

−limk→∞∇2F⁢(wk)⊤⁢w∞λk−wkλk=w⋆.subscript→𝑘superscript∇2𝐹superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘topsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘subscript𝑤𝑘subscript𝜆𝑘superscript𝑤⋆-\lim_{k\to\infty}\nabla^{2}F(w_{k})^{\top}\frac{w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}-w_{k% }}{\lambda_{k}}=w^{\star}.- roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (13)

Let uk=PKer⁢(∇2F⁢(wk))⁢w∞λk−wkλksubscript𝑢𝑘subscript𝑃Kersuperscript∇2𝐹subscript𝑤𝑘subscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘subscript𝑤𝑘subscript𝜆𝑘u_{k}=P_{\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w_{k}))}\frac{w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}-w_{k}% }{\lambda_{k}}italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ker ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Note that

∇2F⁢(wk)⊤⁢w∞λk−wkλk=∇2F⁢(wk)⊤⁢uksuperscript∇2𝐹superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘topsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘subscript𝑤𝑘subscript𝜆𝑘superscript∇2𝐹superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘topsubscript𝑢𝑘\displaystyle\nabla^{2}F(w_{k})^{\top}\frac{w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty}-w_{k}}{% \lambda_{k}}=\nabla^{2}F(w_{k})^{\top}u_{k}∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
and‖∇2F⁢(wk)⊤⁢uk‖≥η⁢‖uk‖,andnormsuperscript∇2𝐹superscriptsubscript𝑤𝑘topsubscript𝑢𝑘𝜂normsubscript𝑢𝑘\displaystyle\text{and}\quad\|\nabla^{2}F(w_{k})^{\top}u_{k}\|\geq\eta\|u_{k}\|,and ∥ ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ ≥ italic_η ∥ italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ ,

thanks to Assumption 2. In consequence, (uk)ksubscriptsubscript𝑢𝑘𝑘(u_{k})_{k}( italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is bounded. In particular, it admits an adherence point u∞∈ℝdsubscript𝑢superscriptℝ𝑑u_{\infty}\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Since wk⁢→k→∞⁢w⋆subscript𝑤𝑘→𝑘→superscript𝑤⋆w_{k}\underset{k\to\infty}{\rightarrow}w^{\star}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_k → ∞ end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG → end_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ∇2Fsuperscript∇2𝐹\nabla^{2}F∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F is continuous, ‖∇2F⁢(wk)−∇2F⁢(w⋆)‖⁢→k→∞⁢0normsuperscript∇2𝐹subscript𝑤𝑘superscript∇2𝐹superscript𝑤⋆→𝑘→0\|\nabla^{2}F(w_{k})-\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star})\|\underset{k\to\infty}{\rightarrow}0∥ ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_UNDERACCENT italic_k → ∞ end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG → end_ARG 0. So that Equation 13 becomes

−∇2F⁢(w⋆)⊤⁢u∞=w⋆.superscript∇2𝐹superscriptsuperscript𝑤⋆topsubscript𝑢superscript𝑤⋆-\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star})^{\top}u_{\infty}=w^{\star}.- ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

In particular, it yields that w⋆∈Im⁢(∇2F⁢(w⋆))superscript𝑤⋆Imsuperscript∇2𝐹superscript𝑤⋆w^{\star}\in\mathrm{Im}(\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star}))italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ roman_Im ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ). By symmetry of the Hessian, Im⁢(∇2F⁢(w⋆))=Ker⁢(∇2F⁢(w⋆))⟂Imsuperscript∇2𝐹superscript𝑤⋆Kersuperscriptsuperscript∇2𝐹superscript𝑤⋆perpendicular-to\mathrm{Im}(\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star}))=\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w^{\star}))^{\perp}roman_Im ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = roman_Ker ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟂ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT so that the adherence point w⋆superscript𝑤⋆w^{\star}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT of (w∞λk)ksubscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝑤subscript𝜆𝑘𝑘(w^{\lambda_{k}}_{\infty})_{k}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfies the KKT conditions of Equation 7, which are equivalent to ∎

A.5 Proof of Proposition 4

See 4

Proof.

For this proof, denote w⋆=limt→∞w~∘⁢(t)superscript𝑤⋆subscript→𝑡superscript~𝑤𝑡w^{\star}=\lim_{t\to\infty}\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) and F⋆=F⁢(w⋆)superscript𝐹⋆𝐹superscript𝑤⋆F^{\star}=F(w^{\star})italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). w⋆superscript𝑤⋆w^{\star}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a strict local minimum of the Euclidean norm on ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M. Moreover using the Morse Bott property [Assumption 2 and see Rebjock and Boumal, 2024], we can consider an arbitrarily small δ>0𝛿0\delta>0italic_δ > 0 such that the following conditions simultaneously hold in B⁢(0,δ)𝐵0𝛿B(0,\delta)italic_B ( 0 , italic_δ ) for some β>0𝛽0\beta>0italic_β > 0:

∀w∈ℳ∩B⁢(0,2⁢δ),w≠w⋆⟹‖w⋆‖2<‖w‖2,formulae-sequencefor-all𝑤ℳ𝐵02𝛿𝑤superscript𝑤⋆superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆2superscriptnorm𝑤2\displaystyle\forall w\in\mathcal{M}\cap B(0,2\delta),w\neq w^{\star}\implies% \|w^{\star}\|^{2}<\|w\|^{2},∀ italic_w ∈ caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ( 0 , 2 italic_δ ) , italic_w ≠ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟹ ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < ∥ italic_w ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,
∀w∈B⁢(0,δ),F⁢(w)−F⋆≥η4⁢d⁢(w,ℳ)2,formulae-sequencefor-all𝑤𝐵0𝛿𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆𝜂4𝑑superscript𝑤ℳ2\displaystyle\forall w\in B(0,\delta),F(w)-F^{\star}\geq\frac{\eta}{4}d(w,% \mathcal{M})^{2},∀ italic_w ∈ italic_B ( 0 , italic_δ ) , italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , (14)
∀w∈B⁢(0,δ),β⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆)≥‖∇F⁢(w)‖22≥η⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆).formulae-sequencefor-all𝑤𝐵0𝛿𝛽𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆superscriptsubscriptnorm∇𝐹𝑤22𝜂𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆\displaystyle\forall w\in B(0,\delta),\beta(F(w)-F^{\star})\geq\|\nabla F(w)\|% _{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w)-F^{\star}).∀ italic_w ∈ italic_B ( 0 , italic_δ ) , italic_β ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≥ ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ italic_η ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

First observe that the strict minimality assumption implies, through Lemma 8, that there exists ε0>0subscript𝜀00\varepsilon_{0}>0italic_ε start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 (independent of λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ) such that for a small enough λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0

inf∂B⁢(w⋆,δ)Fλ⁢(w)>F⋆+λ⁢‖w⋆‖22+λ⁢ε0.subscriptinfimum𝐵superscript𝑤⋆𝛿subscript𝐹𝜆𝑤superscript𝐹⋆𝜆superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆22𝜆subscript𝜀0\inf_{\partial B(w^{\star},\delta)}F_{\lambda}(w)>F^{\star}+\lambda\frac{\|w^{% \star}\|^{2}}{2}+\lambda\varepsilon_{0}.roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∂ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ divide start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_λ italic_ε start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (15)

Now fix an arbitrarily small δ′∈(0,δ)superscript𝛿′0𝛿\delta^{\prime}\in(0,\delta)italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ ( 0 , italic_δ ). Let t0∈ℝ+∗subscript𝑡0superscriptsubscriptℝt_{0}\in\mathbb{R}_{+}^{*}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that ‖w~∘⁢(t0)−w⋆‖≤δ′4normsuperscript~𝑤subscript𝑡0superscript𝑤⋆superscript𝛿′4\|\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t_{0})-w^{\star}\|\leq\frac{\delta^{\prime}}{4}∥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG. By pointwise convergence of w~λ⁢(t0)superscript~𝑤𝜆subscript𝑡0\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t_{0})over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) to w~∘⁢(t0)superscript~𝑤subscript𝑡0\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t_{0})over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), we then have that for λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0 small enough, ‖w~λ⁢(t0)−w⋆‖≤δ′2normsuperscript~𝑤𝜆subscript𝑡0superscript𝑤⋆superscript𝛿′2\|\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t_{0})-w^{\star}\|\leq\frac{\delta^{\prime}}{2}∥ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG. Fλ⁢(w~λ⁢(t0))≤F⋆+ε.subscript𝐹𝜆superscript~𝑤𝜆subscript𝑡0superscript𝐹⋆𝜀F_{\lambda}(\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t_{0}))\leq F^{\star}+\varepsilon.italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ≤ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ε . (16)

From there, we define for this proof Tλ=inf{t≥t0∣w~λ⁢(t)∉B⁢(w⋆,δ′)}subscript𝑇𝜆infimumconditional-set𝑡subscript𝑡0superscript~𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐵superscript𝑤⋆superscript𝛿′T_{\lambda}=\inf\{t\geq t_{0}\mid\tilde{w}^{\lambda}(t)\not\in B(w^{\star},% \delta^{\prime})\}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_inf { italic_t ≥ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∣ over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∉ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) }. Similarly to the proof of Lemma 7, we have for any t∈(t0λ,Tλλ)𝑡subscript𝑡0𝜆subscript𝑇𝜆𝜆t\in(\frac{t_{0}}{\lambda},\frac{T_{\lambda}}{\lambda})italic_t ∈ ( divide start_ARG italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ):

d⁢Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))d⁢tdsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡d𝑡\displaystyle\frac{\mathrm{d}F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))}{\mathrm{d}t}divide start_ARG roman_d italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_d italic_t end_ARG ≤−η⁢(Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))−F⋆)+λ⁢(R1+η2⁢R2),absent𝜂subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂2superscript𝑅2\displaystyle\leq-\eta(F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star})+\lambda(R_{1}+% \frac{\eta}{2}R^{2}),≤ - italic_η ( italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_λ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

where R1=supw∈B⁢(w⋆,δ′)‖w‖⁢‖∇F⁢(w)‖subscript𝑅1subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐵superscript𝑤⋆superscript𝛿′norm𝑤norm∇𝐹𝑤R_{1}=\sup_{w\in B(w^{\star},\delta^{\prime})}\|w\|\|\nabla F(w)\|italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) ∥ and R=supw∈B⁢(w⋆,δ′)‖w‖𝑅subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐵superscript𝑤⋆superscript𝛿′norm𝑤R=\sup_{w\in B(w^{\star},\delta^{\prime})}\|w\|italic_R = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥. Again, a Grönwall argument implies that for any t∈[t0λ,Tλλ]𝑡subscript𝑡0𝜆subscript𝑇𝜆𝜆t\in[\frac{t_{0}}{\lambda},\frac{T_{\lambda}}{\lambda}]italic_t ∈ [ divide start_ARG italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ],

Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))≤ε⁢e−η⁢(t−t0λ)+λ⁢(R22+R1η).subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜀superscript𝑒𝜂𝑡subscript𝑡0𝜆𝜆superscript𝑅22subscript𝑅1𝜂\displaystyle F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))\leq\varepsilon e^{-\eta(t-\frac{t_{0% }}{\lambda})}+\lambda\left(\frac{R^{2}}{2}+\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}\right).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ≤ italic_ε italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η ( italic_t - divide start_ARG italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG ) .

In particular, if we define t′=min⁡(t0λ−ln⁡(λ)η,Tλλ)superscript𝑡′subscript𝑡0𝜆𝜆𝜂subscript𝑇𝜆𝜆t^{\prime}=\min(\frac{t_{0}}{\lambda}-\frac{\ln(\lambda)}{\eta},\frac{T_{% \lambda}}{\lambda})italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_min ( divide start_ARG italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG - divide start_ARG roman_ln ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG , divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ), we have similarly to the proof of Lemma 7 that for any t∈[t0λ,t′]𝑡subscript𝑡0𝜆superscript𝑡′t\in[\frac{t_{0}}{\lambda},t^{\prime}]italic_t ∈ [ divide start_ARG italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]:

‖wλ⁢(t)−wλ⁢(t0λ)‖≤β⁢ε⁢2η−C⁢λ⁢ln⁡(λ),normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆subscript𝑡0𝜆𝛽𝜀2𝜂𝐶𝜆𝜆\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{\lambda}(\frac{t_{0}}{\lambda})\right\|\leq\beta\sqrt% {\varepsilon}\frac{2}{\eta}-C\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(\lambda),∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ∥ ≤ italic_β square-root start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG - italic_C square-root start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_λ ) ,

for some constant C𝐶Citalic_C independent of ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ. In particular, we can choose ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ small enough so that this quantity is smaller than δ2𝛿2\frac{\delta}{2}divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG. It then implies that t′<Tλλsuperscript𝑡′subscript𝑇𝜆𝜆t^{\prime}<\frac{T_{\lambda}}{\lambda}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < divide start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG and

Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t′))≤F⋆+λ⁢(R1η+R22+ε).subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆superscript𝑡′superscript𝐹⋆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂superscript𝑅22𝜀F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t^{\prime}))\leq F^{\star}+\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+% \frac{R^{2}}{2}+\varepsilon).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ≤ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_ε ) .

From there, by monotonicity of the loss, for any t≥t′𝑡superscript𝑡′t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t ≥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT:

Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))≤F⋆+λ⁢(R1η+R22+ε).subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂superscript𝑅22𝜀F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))\leq F^{\star}+\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{R^{% 2}}{2}+\varepsilon).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ≤ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_ε ) .

Also note that R1η+R22⁢→δ′→0⁢‖w⋆‖22subscript𝑅1𝜂superscript𝑅22→superscript𝛿′0→superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆22\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{R^{2}}{2}\underset{\delta^{\prime}\to 0}{\rightarrow}% \frac{\|w^{\star}\|^{2}}{2}divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_UNDERACCENT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → 0 end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG → end_ARG divide start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG. So we can choose δ′superscript𝛿′\delta^{\prime}italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε small enough so that

R1η+R22+ε<‖w⋆‖22+ε0.subscript𝑅1𝜂superscript𝑅22𝜀superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆22subscript𝜀0\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{R^{2}}{2}+\varepsilon<\frac{\|w^{\star}\|^{2}}{2}+% \varepsilon_{0}.divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_ε < divide start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_ε start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

From there, the previous inequality implies that for any t≥t′𝑡superscript𝑡′t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t ≥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT,

Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))≤F⋆+λ⁢(‖w⋆‖22+ε0).subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆𝜆superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆22subscript𝜀0F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))\leq F^{\star}+\lambda(\frac{\|w^{\star}\|^{2}}{2}+% \varepsilon_{0}).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ≤ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_ε start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

By continuity, Equation 15 then implies that for any t≥t′𝑡superscript𝑡′t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t ≥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, wλ⁢(t)∈B⁢(w⋆,δ)superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐵superscript𝑤⋆𝛿w^{\lambda}(t)\in B(w^{\star},\delta)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ ).

To summarise, we have shown that for any small enough δ>0𝛿0\delta>0italic_δ > 0, there exists λ⋆⁢(δ)superscript𝜆⋆𝛿\lambda^{\star}(\delta)italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_δ ) and t′⁢(λ,δ)superscript𝑡′𝜆𝛿t^{\prime}(\lambda,\delta)italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_λ , italic_δ ) such that for any λ≤λ⋆⁢(δ)𝜆superscript𝜆⋆𝛿\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}(\delta)italic_λ ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_δ ), limt→∞wλ⁢(t)∈B⁢(w⋆,δ)subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐵superscript𝑤⋆𝛿\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)\in B(w^{\star},\delta)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ ).

This means that limλ→0limt→∞wλ⁢(t)=w⋆subscript→𝜆0subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤⋆\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)=w^{\star}roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ → 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which proves Proposition 4. ∎

Appendix B Auxiliary proofs

B.1 Proof of Lemma 1

See 1

Proof.

First, we restrict ourselves to a bounded open set B𝐵Bitalic_B of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and consider ϕ⁢(⋅,t)italic-ϕ⋅𝑡\phi(\cdot,t)italic_ϕ ( ⋅ , italic_t ) as a function B→ℝd→𝐵superscriptℝ𝑑B\to\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_B → blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for any t𝑡titalic_t.

The main point of the proof is to show that ℳ∩Bℳ𝐵\mathcal{M}\cap Bcaligraphic_M ∩ italic_B is geometrically stable in the sense of Falconer [1983], i.e., that there exists a neighbourhood (in B𝐵Bitalic_B) U𝑈Uitalic_U of ℳ∩Bℳ𝐵\mathcal{M}\cap Bcaligraphic_M ∩ italic_B, s>0𝑠0s>0italic_s > 0 and k<1𝑘1k<1italic_k < 1 such that for any u∈U𝑢𝑈u\in Uitalic_u ∈ italic_U and t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0,

d⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t+s),ℳ∩B)≤k⁢d⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t),ℳ∩B),𝑑italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡𝑠ℳ𝐵𝑘𝑑italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡ℳ𝐵d(\phi(w,t+s),\mathcal{M}\cap B)\leq kd(\phi(w,t),\mathcal{M}\cap B),italic_d ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t + italic_s ) , caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ) ≤ italic_k italic_d ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) , caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ) ,

where d⁢(v,ℳ)=infx∈ℳ‖v−x‖2𝑑𝑣ℳsubscriptinfimum𝑥ℳsubscriptnorm𝑣𝑥2d(v,\mathcal{M})=\inf_{x\in\mathcal{M}}\|v-x\|_{2}italic_d ( italic_v , caligraphic_M ) = roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_v - italic_x ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.333The definition of Falconer [1983] is stated differently but a consequence of ours, by defining the open set W={ϕ⁢(w,t)∣w∈U,t≥0}𝑊conditional-setitalic-ϕ𝑤𝑡formulae-sequence𝑤𝑈𝑡0W=\{\phi(w,t)\mid w\in U,t\geq 0\}italic_W = { italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ∣ italic_w ∈ italic_U , italic_t ≥ 0 } and f⁢(w)=ϕ⁢(w,s)𝑓𝑤italic-ϕ𝑤𝑠f(w)=\phi(w,s)italic_f ( italic_w ) = italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_s ).

Let x∈ℳ∩B𝑥ℳ𝐵x\in\mathcal{M}\cap Bitalic_x ∈ caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B. The Morse-Bott property (Assumption 2) implies that there exists a neighbourhood U⁢(x)⊂B𝑈𝑥𝐵U(x)\subset Bitalic_U ( italic_x ) ⊂ italic_B of x𝑥xitalic_x, such that F𝐹Fitalic_F satisfies the Polyak-Łojasiewicz (PL) inequality with constant η2𝜂2\frac{\eta}{2}divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG, thanks to the equivalences between both conditions [Rebjock and Boumal, 2024]

‖∇F⁢(w)‖22≥η⁢(F⁢(w)−F⁢(x))∀w∈U⁢(x).formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptnorm∇𝐹𝑤22𝜂𝐹𝑤𝐹𝑥for-all𝑤𝑈𝑥\|\nabla F(w)\|_{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w)-F(x))\quad\forall w\in U(x).∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ italic_η ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F ( italic_x ) ) ∀ italic_w ∈ italic_U ( italic_x ) . (17)

In the following, we define F⋆=F⁢(x)superscript𝐹⋆𝐹𝑥F^{\star}=F(x)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_x ), which is the value of F𝐹Fitalic_F on the manifold ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M (the definition does not depend on the choice of x𝑥xitalic_x).

In particular, there is some δ0⁢(x)>0subscript𝛿0𝑥0\delta_{0}(x)>0italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) > 0 such that B⁢(x,δ0⁢(x))⊂U⁢(x)𝐵𝑥subscript𝛿0𝑥𝑈𝑥B(x,\delta_{0}(x))\subset U(x)italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) ) ⊂ italic_U ( italic_x ). Thanks to Rebjock and Boumal [2024, Propositions 2.3 and 2.8, Remark 2.10], we can even choose δ0⁢(x)subscript𝛿0𝑥\delta_{0}(x)italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) small enough so that there are some α,β𝛼𝛽\alpha,\betaitalic_α , italic_β such that

‖∇F⁢(w)‖2≤β⁢F⁢(w)−F⋆for any ⁢w∈B⁢(x,δ0),formulae-sequencesubscriptnorm∇𝐹𝑤2𝛽𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆for any 𝑤𝐵𝑥subscript𝛿0\displaystyle\|\nabla F(w)\|_{2}\leq\beta\sqrt{F(w)-F^{\star}}\quad\text{for % any }w\in B(x,\delta_{0}),∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_β square-root start_ARG italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG for any italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (18)
η8⁢d⁢(w,ℳ)2≤F⁢(w)−F⋆≤α⁢d⁢(w,ℳ)2⁢for any ⁢w∈B⁢(x,δ0).𝜂8𝑑superscript𝑤ℳ2𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆𝛼𝑑superscript𝑤ℳ2for any 𝑤𝐵𝑥subscript𝛿0\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{8}d(w,\mathcal{M})^{2}\leq F(w)-F^{\star}\leq\alpha d% (w,\mathcal{M})^{2}\text{for any }w\in B(x,\delta_{0}).divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 8 end_ARG italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ italic_α italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for any italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (19)

By boundedness of B𝐵Bitalic_B, note that α𝛼\alphaitalic_α and β𝛽\betaitalic_β can be chosen indepently of x∈ℳ∩B𝑥ℳ𝐵x\in\mathcal{M}\cap Bitalic_x ∈ caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B here.

Now let w∈B⁢(x,δ0⁢(x))𝑤𝐵𝑥subscript𝛿0𝑥w\in B(x,\delta_{0}(x))italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) ) and define T⁢(w)=inf{t≥0∣ϕ⁢(w,t)∉B⁢(x,δ0⁢(x))}𝑇𝑤infimumconditional-set𝑡0italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡𝐵𝑥subscript𝛿0𝑥T(w)=\inf\{t\geq 0\mid\phi(w,t)\not\in B(x,\delta_{0}(x))\}italic_T ( italic_w ) = roman_inf { italic_t ≥ 0 ∣ italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ∉ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) ) }. Necessarily, T⁢(w)>0𝑇𝑤0T(w)>0italic_T ( italic_w ) > 0 and for any t∈[0,T⁢(w))𝑡0𝑇𝑤t\in[0,T(w))italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ( italic_w ) ), Equation 17 applies to ϕ⁢(w,t)italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡\phi(w,t)italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ), so that for any t∈[0,T⁢(w))𝑡0𝑇𝑤t\in[0,T(w))italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ( italic_w ) )

d⁢(F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t))−F⋆)d⁢td𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡superscript𝐹⋆d𝑡\displaystyle\frac{\mathrm{d}(F(\phi(w,t))-F^{\star})}{\mathrm{d}t}divide start_ARG roman_d ( italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_d italic_t end_ARG =−‖∇F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t))‖2absentsuperscriptnorm∇𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡2\displaystyle=-\|\nabla F(\phi(w,t))\|^{2}= - ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤−η⁢(F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t))−F⋆).absent𝜂𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡superscript𝐹⋆\displaystyle\leq-\eta(F(\phi(w,t))-F^{\star}).≤ - italic_η ( italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

So that, for any t∈[0,T⁢(w))𝑡0𝑇𝑤t\in[0,T(w))italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ( italic_w ) ):

F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t))−F⋆≤(F⁢(w)−F⋆)⁢e−η⁢t.𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡superscript𝐹⋆𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆superscript𝑒𝜂𝑡F(\phi(w,t))-F^{\star}\leq(F(w)-F^{\star})e^{-\eta t}.italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Moreover for any t∈[0,T⁢(w))𝑡0𝑇𝑤t\in[0,T(w))italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ( italic_w ) ), Equation 18 also applies, so that

‖ϕ⁢(w,t)−w‖normitalic-ϕ𝑤𝑡𝑤\displaystyle\|\phi(w,t)-w\|∥ italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) - italic_w ∥ ≤∫0t‖∇F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,s))‖2⁢dsabsentsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡subscriptnorm∇𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑠2differential-d𝑠\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{t}\|\nabla F(\phi(w,s))\|_{2}\mathrm{d}s≤ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_s ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_d italic_s
