≤∫0tβ⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆)⁢e−η⁢s⁢dsabsentsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡𝛽𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆superscript𝑒𝜂𝑠differential-d𝑠\displaystyle\leq\int_{0}^{t}\beta\sqrt{(F(w)-F^{\star})e^{-\eta s}}\mathrm{d}s≤ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_β square-root start_ARG ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η italic_s end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_d italic_s
≤2⁢βη⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆).absent2𝛽𝜂𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆\displaystyle\leq\frac{2\beta}{\eta}\sqrt{(F(w)-F^{\star})}.≤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_β end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG square-root start_ARG ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG .

By continuity of F𝐹Fitalic_F, let δ⁢(x)>0𝛿𝑥0\delta(x)>0italic_δ ( italic_x ) > 0 be small enough so that for any w∈B⁢(x,δ⁢(x))𝑤𝐵𝑥𝛿𝑥w\in B(x,\delta(x))italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ ( italic_x ) ), δ⁢(x)+2⁢βη⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆)≤δ0⁢(x)2𝛿𝑥2𝛽𝜂𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆subscript𝛿0𝑥2\delta(x)+\frac{2\beta}{\eta}\sqrt{(F(w)-F^{\star})}\leq\frac{\delta_{0}(x)}{2}italic_δ ( italic_x ) + divide start_ARG 2 italic_β end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG square-root start_ARG ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG. The previous inequality then implies that for any w∈B⁢(x,δ⁢(x))𝑤𝐵𝑥𝛿𝑥w\in B(x,\delta(x))italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ ( italic_x ) ) and t∈[0,T⁢(w))𝑡0𝑇𝑤t\in[0,T(w))italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ( italic_w ) ):

‖ϕ⁢(w,t)−x‖normitalic-ϕ𝑤𝑡𝑥\displaystyle\|\phi(w,t)-x\|∥ italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) - italic_x ∥ ≤‖w−x‖+‖ϕ⁢(w,t)−w‖absentnorm𝑤𝑥normitalic-ϕ𝑤𝑡𝑤\displaystyle\leq\|w-x\|+\|\phi(w,t)-w\|≤ ∥ italic_w - italic_x ∥ + ∥ italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) - italic_w ∥
≤δ⁢(x)+2⁢β⁢(x)η⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆)absent𝛿𝑥2𝛽𝑥𝜂𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆\displaystyle\leq\delta(x)+\frac{2\beta(x)}{\eta}\sqrt{(F(w)-F^{\star})}≤ italic_δ ( italic_x ) + divide start_ARG 2 italic_β ( italic_x ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG square-root start_ARG ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG
≤δ0⁢(x)2.absentsubscript𝛿0𝑥2\displaystyle\leq\frac{\delta_{0}(x)}{2}.≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG .

In particular, for any w∈B⁢(x,δ⁢(x))𝑤𝐵𝑥𝛿𝑥w\in B(x,\delta(x))italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ ( italic_x ) ), T⁢(w)=∞𝑇𝑤T(w)=\inftyitalic_T ( italic_w ) = ∞ and ϕ⁢(w,t)∈B⁢(x,δ0⁢(x))italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡𝐵𝑥subscript𝛿0𝑥\phi(w,t)\in B(x,\delta_{0}(x))italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) ) for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0.

Also, note that ‖ϕ⁢(w,t)−x‖≤δ0⁢(x)2normitalic-ϕ𝑤𝑡𝑥subscript𝛿0𝑥2\|\phi(w,t)-x\|\leq\frac{\delta_{0}(x)}{2}∥ italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) - italic_x ∥ ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG and B⁢(x,δ0⁢(x))⊂B𝐵𝑥subscript𝛿0𝑥𝐵B(x,\delta_{0}(x))\subset Bitalic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) ) ⊂ italic_B implies that d⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t),ℳ∩B)=d⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t),ℳ)𝑑italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡ℳ𝐵𝑑italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡ℳd(\phi(w,t),\mathcal{M}\cap B)=d(\phi(w,t),\mathcal{M})italic_d ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) , caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ) = italic_d ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) , caligraphic_M ). From there, Equation 19 implies for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0 and w∈B⁢(x,δ⁢(x))𝑤𝐵𝑥𝛿𝑥w\in B(x,\delta(x))italic_w ∈ italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ ( italic_x ) ):

d⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t),ℳ∩B)2𝑑superscriptitalic-ϕ𝑤𝑡ℳ𝐵2\displaystyle d(\phi(w,t),\mathcal{M}\cap B)^{2}italic_d ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) , caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤8η(F(ϕ(w,t))−F⋆)\displaystyle\leq\frac{8}{\eta}(F(\phi(w,t))-F\star)≤ divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG ( italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) - italic_F ⋆ )
≤8η⁢e−η⁢t⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆)absent8𝜂superscript𝑒𝜂𝑡𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆\displaystyle\leq\frac{8}{\eta}e^{-\eta t}(F(w)-F^{\star})≤ divide start_ARG 8 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
≤8⁢αη⁢e−η⁢t⁢d⁢(w,ℳ∩B)2.absent8𝛼𝜂superscript𝑒𝜂𝑡𝑑superscript𝑤ℳ𝐵2\displaystyle\leq\frac{8\alpha}{\eta}e^{-\eta t}d(w,\mathcal{M}\cap B)^{2}.≤ divide start_ARG 8 italic_α end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

In particular, for a sufficiently large t𝑡titalic_t, d⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t),ℳ∩B)≤k⁢d⁢(w,ℳ∩B)𝑑italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡ℳ𝐵𝑘𝑑𝑤ℳ𝐵d(\phi(w,t),\mathcal{M}\cap B)\leq kd(w,\mathcal{M}\cap B)italic_d ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) , caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ) ≤ italic_k italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ) for some k<1𝑘1k<1italic_k < 1. Then taking U⁢(B)=⋃x∈ℳ∩BB⁢(x,δ⁢(x))𝑈𝐵subscript𝑥ℳ𝐵𝐵𝑥𝛿𝑥U(B)=\bigcup_{x\in\mathcal{M}\cap B}B(x,\delta(x))italic_U ( italic_B ) = ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_B ( italic_x , italic_δ ( italic_x ) ), ℳ∩Bℳ𝐵\mathcal{M}\cap Bcaligraphic_M ∩ italic_B is geometrically stable for f:w↦ϕ⁢(w,t):𝑓maps-to𝑤italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡f:w\mapsto\phi(w,t)italic_f : italic_w ↦ italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ).

Additionally thanks to our previous remark, U𝑈Uitalic_U is invariant by f𝑓fitalic_f. We can now apply Falconer [1983, Lemma 6.2 and Theorem 5.1], which implies that ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ is 𝒞2superscript𝒞2\mathcal{C}^{2}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on U⁢(B)𝑈𝐵U(B)italic_U ( italic_B ). Taking an increasing sequence of open bounded sets Bnsubscript𝐵𝑛B_{n}italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT covering whole ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we can then define U=⋃nU⁢(Bn)𝑈subscript𝑛𝑈subscript𝐵𝑛U=\bigcup_{n}U(B_{n})italic_U = ⋃ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_U ( italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and conclude that ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ is 𝒞2superscript𝒞2\mathcal{C}^{2}caligraphic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on U𝑈Uitalic_U.

∎

B.2 Minimality of F𝐹Fitalic_F on neighbourhood

Lemma 5.

Consider Assumptions 1 and 2. Let U𝑈Uitalic_U be an open neighbourhood of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M such that ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ is continuous on U𝑈Uitalic_U, then necessarily for any w∈U∖ℳ𝑤𝑈ℳw\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w ∈ italic_U ∖ caligraphic_M, F⁢(w)=supx∈ℳF⁢(x)𝐹𝑤subscriptsupremum𝑥ℳ𝐹𝑥F(w)=\sup_{x\in\mathcal{M}}F(x)italic_F ( italic_w ) = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_x ).

Proof.

By definition of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M, F𝐹Fitalic_F is constant on ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M so that supx∈ℳF⁢(x)=infx∈ℳF⁢(x)=F⋆subscriptsupremum𝑥ℳ𝐹𝑥subscriptinfimum𝑥ℳ𝐹𝑥superscript𝐹⋆\sup_{x\in\mathcal{M}}F(x)=\inf_{x\in\mathcal{M}}F(x)=F^{\star}roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_x ) = roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_x ) = italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Moreover Φ⁢(ℳ)=ℳΦℳℳ\Phi(\mathcal{M})=\mathcal{M}roman_Φ ( caligraphic_M ) = caligraphic_M and by continuity, Φ⁢(U)⊂ℳΦ𝑈ℳ\Phi(U)\subset\mathcal{M}roman_Φ ( italic_U ) ⊂ caligraphic_M.

For any w∈U∖ℳ𝑤𝑈ℳw\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w ∈ italic_U ∖ caligraphic_M, note that

w−Φ⁢(w)=−∫0∞∇F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t))⁢dt,𝑤Φ𝑤superscriptsubscript0∇𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡differential-d𝑡\displaystyle w-\Phi(w)=-\int_{0}^{\infty}\nabla F(\phi(w,t))\mathrm{d}t,italic_w - roman_Φ ( italic_w ) = - ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∇ italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) roman_d italic_t ,
F⁢(w)−F⋆=F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,0))−F⁢(Φ⁢(w))=−∫0∞‖∇F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t))‖2⁢dt.𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤0𝐹Φ𝑤superscriptsubscript0superscriptnorm∇𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡2differential-d𝑡\displaystyle F(w)-F^{\star}=F(\phi(w,0))-F(\Phi(w))=-\int_{0}^{\infty}\|% \nabla F(\phi(w,t))\|^{2}\mathrm{d}t.italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , 0 ) ) - italic_F ( roman_Φ ( italic_w ) ) = - ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_d italic_t .

The first equality is the definition of Φ⁢(w)Φ𝑤\Phi(w)roman_Φ ( italic_w ), while the second comes from deriving over time the function t↦F⁢(ϕ⁢(w,t))maps-to𝑡𝐹italic-ϕ𝑤𝑡t\mapsto F(\phi(w,t))italic_t ↦ italic_F ( italic_ϕ ( italic_w , italic_t ) ) and noting that Φ⁢(w)∈ℳΦ𝑤ℳ\Phi(w)\in\mathcal{M}roman_Φ ( italic_w ) ∈ caligraphic_M.

In particular, for any w∈U∖ℳ𝑤𝑈ℳw\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w ∈ italic_U ∖ caligraphic_M, w−Φ⁢(w)≠0𝑤Φ𝑤0w-\Phi(w)\neq 0italic_w - roman_Φ ( italic_w ) ≠ 0, so that the second integral is also non-zero. In particular, F⁢(w)>F⋆𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆F(w)>F^{\star}italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for any w∈U∖ℳ𝑤𝑈ℳw\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w ∈ italic_U ∖ caligraphic_M. ∎

B.3 Alternative equation for w~∘superscript~𝑤\tilde{w}^{\circ}over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

Lemma 6.

If Assumption 2 holds, the unique solution of Equation 6 also corresponds to the unique solution of the following equation:

w~˙∘⁢(t)=−D⁢Φw~∘⁢(t)⁢(w~∘⁢(t)) and w~∘⁢(0)=Φ⁢(w0).formulae-sequencesuperscript˙~𝑤𝑡𝐷subscriptΦsuperscript~𝑤𝑡superscript~𝑤𝑡 and superscript~𝑤0Φsubscript𝑤0\dot{\tilde{w}}^{\circ}(t)=-D\Phi_{\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)}(\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t))% \quad\text{ and }\quad\tilde{w}^{\circ}(0)=\Phi(w_{0}).over˙ start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = - italic_D roman_Φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) and over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) = roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .
Proof.

This is a direct consequence of the two following equalities for any w∈ℳ𝑤ℳw\in\mathcal{M}italic_w ∈ caligraphic_M:

gradℳ⁢ℓ2⁢(w)subscriptgradℳsubscriptℓ2𝑤\displaystyle\mathrm{grad}_{\mathcal{M}}\ \ell_{2}(w)roman_grad start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) =PKer⁢(∇2F⁢(w))⁢(w)absentsubscript𝑃Kersuperscript∇2𝐹𝑤𝑤\displaystyle=P_{\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w))}(w)= italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ker ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w )
=D⁢Φw⁢(w).absent𝐷subscriptΦ𝑤𝑤\displaystyle=D\Phi_{w}(w).= italic_D roman_Φ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) .

The first one is a consequence of the definition of the Riemannian gradient and the fact that Tℳ⁢(w)=Ker⁢(∇2F⁢(w))subscript𝑇ℳ𝑤Kersuperscript∇2𝐹𝑤T_{\mathcal{M}}(w)=\mathrm{Ker}(\nabla^{2}F(w))italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) = roman_Ker ( ∇ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) ) [see e.g., Boumal, 2023, Theorem 3.15 with ∇F∇𝐹\nabla F∇ italic_F being the local defining function of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M]. The second one is given by Li et al. [2021, Lemma 4.3]. ∎

B.4 Bounding the trajectories

Lemma 7.

If Assumptions 1 and 2 hold, there exists a compact K𝐾Kitalic_K of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for any λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0 and t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0, wλ⁢(t)∈Ksuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐾w^{\lambda}(t)\in Kitalic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_K.
In particular, limt→∞wλ⁢(t)subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) exists for any λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0.

Proof.

Similarly to the proof of Lemma 1, we can consider a neighbourhood U𝑈Uitalic_U of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M where the PL inequality holds:

‖∇F⁢(w)‖22≥η⁢(F⁢(w)−F⋆)∀w∈U.formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptnorm∇𝐹𝑤22𝜂𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆for-all𝑤𝑈\|\nabla F(w)\|_{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w)-F^{\star})\quad\forall w\in U.∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ italic_η ( italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∀ italic_w ∈ italic_U .

Additionally, we can consider δ>0𝛿0\delta>0italic_δ > 0 such that B⁢(Φ⁢(w0),δ)⊂U𝐵Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿𝑈B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)\subset Uitalic_B ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_δ ) ⊂ italic_U and

‖∇F⁢(w)‖2≤β⁢F⁢(w)−F⋆for any ⁢w∈B⁢(Φ⁢(w0),δ).formulae-sequencesubscriptnorm∇𝐹𝑤2𝛽𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆for any 𝑤𝐵Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿\|\nabla F(w)\|_{2}\leq\beta\sqrt{F(w)-F^{\star}}\quad\text{for any }w\in B(% \Phi(w_{0}),\delta).∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_β square-root start_ARG italic_F ( italic_w ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG for any italic_w ∈ italic_B ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_δ ) .

1) For some fixed ε>0𝜀0\varepsilon>0italic_ε > 0, Lemma 2 then implies there is a λ⋆>0superscript𝜆⋆0\lambda^{\star}>0italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 and times t⁢(λ)𝑡𝜆t(\lambda)italic_t ( italic_λ ) such that for any λ∈(0,λ⋆)𝜆0superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\in(0,\lambda^{\star})italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) both hold

‖wλ⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)−Φ⁢(w0)‖<δ2andFλ⁢(wλ⁢(t⁢(λ)λ))−F⁢(Φ⁢(w0))≤ε.formulae-sequencenormsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿2andsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆𝐹Φsubscript𝑤0𝜀\|w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})-\Phi(w_{0})\|<\frac{\delta}{2}\quad% \text{and}\quad F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}))-F(\Phi(w_% {0}))\leq\varepsilon.∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) - roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∥ < divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG and italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ) - italic_F ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ≤ italic_ε .

Moreover, the proof of Lemma 2 also implies that there is some compact K1subscript𝐾1K_{1}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for any λ<λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda<\lambda^{\star}italic_λ < italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and t≤t⁢(λ)λ𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆t\leq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_t ≤ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG, wλ⁢(t)∈K1superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡subscript𝐾1w^{\lambda}(t)\in K_{1}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.


2) Now fix λ<λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda<\lambda^{\star}italic_λ < italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and define Tλ=inf{t≥t⁢(λ)λ∣wλ⁢(t)∉B⁢(Φ⁢(w0),δ)}subscript𝑇𝜆infimumconditional-set𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐵Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿T_{\lambda}=\inf\{t\geq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}\mid w^{\lambda}(t)\not\in B(% \Phi(w_{0}),\delta)\}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_inf { italic_t ≥ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∣ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∉ italic_B ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_δ ) }. By continuity, Tλ>t⁢(λ)λsubscript𝑇𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆T_{\lambda}>\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG. The PL inequality then applies for any t∈[t⁢(λ)λ,Tλ)𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆subscript𝑇𝜆t\in[\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},T_{\lambda})italic_t ∈ [ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ):

‖∇F⁢(wλ⁢(t))‖22≥η⁢(F⁢(wλ⁢(t))−F⋆).superscriptsubscriptnorm∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡22𝜂𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}^{2}\geq\eta(F(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star}).∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≥ italic_η ( italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

In particular, this allows to derive the following inequalities for any t∈[t⁢(λ)λ,Tλ)𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆subscript𝑇𝜆t\in[\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},T_{\lambda})italic_t ∈ [ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ):

d⁢Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))d⁢tdsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡d𝑡\displaystyle\frac{\mathrm{d}F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))}{\mathrm{d}t}divide start_ARG roman_d italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_d italic_t end_ARG =−‖∇Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))‖22absentsuperscriptsubscriptnorm∇subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡22\displaystyle=-\|\nabla F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}^{2}= - ∥ ∇ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≤−‖∇F⁢(wλ⁢(t))‖2+λ⁢‖wλ⁢(t)‖2⁢‖∇F⁢(wλ⁢(t))‖2absentsuperscriptnorm∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡2𝜆subscriptnormsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡2subscriptnorm∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡2\displaystyle\leq-\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|^{2}+\lambda\|w^{\lambda}(t)\|_{% 2}\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}≤ - ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
≤−‖∇F⁢(wλ⁢(t))‖22+λ⁢‖wλ⁢(t)‖⁢‖∇F⁢(wλ⁢(t))‖absentsuperscriptsubscriptnorm∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡22𝜆normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡norm∇𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡\displaystyle\leq-\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|_{2}^{2}+\lambda\|w^{\lambda}(t)% \|\|\nabla F(w^{\lambda}(t))\|≤ - ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ∥
≤−η⁢(F⁢(wλ⁢(t))−F⋆)+λ⁢R1absent𝜂𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆𝜆subscript𝑅1\displaystyle\leq-\eta(F(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star})+\lambda R_{1}≤ - italic_η ( italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_λ italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
≤−η⁢(Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))−F⋆)+λ⁢(R1+η2⁢R2),absent𝜂subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂2superscript𝑅2\displaystyle\leq-\eta(F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star})+\lambda(R_{1}+% \frac{\eta}{2}R^{2}),≤ - italic_η ( italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_λ ( italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ,

where R1=supw∈B⁢(Φ⁢(w0),δ)‖w‖⁢‖∇F⁢(w)‖subscript𝑅1subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐵Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿norm𝑤norm∇𝐹𝑤R_{1}=\sup_{w\in B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)}\|w\|\|\nabla F(w)\|italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_B ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_δ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥ ∥ ∇ italic_F ( italic_w ) ∥ and R=supw∈B⁢(Φ⁢(w0),δ)‖w‖𝑅subscriptsupremum𝑤𝐵Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿norm𝑤R=\sup_{w\in B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)}\|w\|italic_R = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ italic_B ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_δ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w ∥. In particular, Grönwall inequality implies that for any t∈[t⁢(λ)λ,Tλ)𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆subscript𝑇𝜆t\in[\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},T_{\lambda})italic_t ∈ [ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))−F⋆subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆\displaystyle F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))-F^{\star}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤(Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t⁢(λ)λ))−F⋆)⁢e−η⁢(t−t⁢(λ)λ)+λ⁢(R1η+12⁢R2)absentsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝐹⋆superscript𝑒𝜂𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂12superscript𝑅2\displaystyle\leq\left(F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}))-F^% {\star}\right)e^{-\eta(t-\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})}+\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{% \eta}+\frac{1}{2}R^{2})≤ ( italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η ( italic_t - divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
≤ε⁢e−η⁢(t−t⁢(λ)λ)+λ⁢(R1η+12⁢R2).absent𝜀superscript𝑒𝜂𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂12superscript𝑅2\displaystyle\leq\varepsilon e^{-\eta(t-\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})}+\lambda(% \frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{1}{2}R^{2}).≤ italic_ε italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η ( italic_t - divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . (20)

Define t′=min⁡(t⁢(λ)λ+−ln⁡(λ)η,Tλ)superscript𝑡′𝑡𝜆𝜆𝜆𝜂subscript𝑇𝜆t^{\prime}=\min(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}+\frac{-\ln(\lambda)}{\eta},T_{% \lambda})italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_min ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG + divide start_ARG - roman_ln ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Using Equation 18 for any t∈(t⁢(λ)λ,t′]𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′t\in(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},t^{\prime}]italic_t ∈ ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]:

wλ⁢(t)−wλ⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆\displaystyle w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) =∫t⁢(λ)λt∇Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(s))⁢dsabsentsuperscriptsubscript𝑡𝜆𝜆𝑡∇subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑠differential-d𝑠\displaystyle=\int_{\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}^{t}\nabla F_{\lambda}(w^{% \lambda}(s))\mathrm{d}s= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∇ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) roman_d italic_s
‖wλ⁢(t)−wλ⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)‖normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆\displaystyle\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})\right\|∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ∥ ≤∫t⁢(λ)λt′‖∇Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(s))‖⁢dsabsentsuperscriptsubscript𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′norm∇subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑠differential-d𝑠\displaystyle\leq\int_{\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}^{t^{\prime}}\|\nabla F_{% \lambda}(w^{\lambda}(s))\|\mathrm{d}s≤ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∇ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) ∥ roman_d italic_s
≤β⁢∫t⁢(λ)λt′F⁢(wλ⁢(s))−F⋆⁢ds.absent𝛽superscriptsubscript𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑠superscript𝐹⋆differential-d𝑠\displaystyle\leq\beta\int_{\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}^{t^{\prime}}\sqrt{F(w^% {\lambda}(s))-F^{\star}}\mathrm{d}s.≤ italic_β ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT square-root start_ARG italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) ) - italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_d italic_s .

From there, Equation 20 yields for any t∈(t⁢(λ)λ,t′]𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′t\in(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},t^{\prime}]italic_t ∈ ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]:

‖wλ⁢(t)−wλ⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)‖normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆\displaystyle\left\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})\right\|∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ∥ ≤β⁢∫t⁢(λ)λt′ε⁢e−η2⁢s⁢ds+β⁢(t′−t⁢(λ)λ)⁢λ⁢(R1η+12⁢R2)absent𝛽superscriptsubscript𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′𝜀superscript𝑒𝜂2𝑠differential-d𝑠𝛽superscript𝑡′𝑡𝜆𝜆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂12superscript𝑅2\displaystyle\leq\beta\int_{\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}}^{t^{\prime}}\sqrt{% \varepsilon}e^{-\frac{\eta}{2}s}\mathrm{d}s+\beta(t^{\prime}-\frac{t(\lambda)}% {\lambda})\sqrt{\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{1}{2}R^{2})}≤ italic_β ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT square-root start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_s end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_d italic_s + italic_β ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) square-root start_ARG italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG
≤β⁢ε⁢2η−C⁢λ⁢ln⁡(λ),absent𝛽𝜀2𝜂𝐶𝜆𝜆\displaystyle\leq\beta\sqrt{\varepsilon}\frac{2}{\eta}-C\sqrt{\lambda}\ln(% \lambda),≤ italic_β square-root start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG - italic_C square-root start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_ln ( italic_λ ) ,

for some constant C𝐶Citalic_C, which is independent of both ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε and λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ. In particular, we can choose ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε and λ⋆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda^{\star}italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT small enough, so that ‖wλ⁢(t)−wλ⁢(t⁢(λ)λ)‖<δ2normsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝜆𝜆𝛿2\|w^{\lambda}(t)-w^{\lambda}(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda})\|<\frac{\delta}{2}∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ) ∥ < divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG for any t∈(t⁢(λ)λ,t′]𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′t\in(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},t^{\prime}]italic_t ∈ ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]. By definition, this implies that t′<Tλsuperscript𝑡′subscript𝑇𝜆t^{\prime}<T_{\lambda}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, i.e., for any t∈[t⁢(λ)λ,t′]𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′t\in[\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},t^{\prime}]italic_t ∈ [ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ], wλ⁢(t)∈B⁢(Φ⁢(w0),δ)superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝐵Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿w^{\lambda}(t)\in B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_B ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_δ ).


3) Since t′<Tλsuperscript𝑡′subscript𝑇𝜆t^{\prime}<T_{\lambda}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT < italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, t′=t⁢(λ)λ+−ln⁡(λ)ηsuperscript𝑡′𝑡𝜆𝜆𝜆𝜂t^{\prime}=\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}+\frac{-\ln(\lambda)}{\eta}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG + divide start_ARG - roman_ln ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG by definition and

Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t′))≤F⋆+λ⁢(R1η+12⁢R2+ε).subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆superscript𝑡′superscript𝐹⋆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂12superscript𝑅2𝜀F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t^{\prime}))\leq F^{\star}+\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+% \frac{1}{2}R^{2}+\varepsilon).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ≤ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ε ) .

By monotonicity of the objective, we then have for any t≥t′𝑡superscript𝑡′t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t ≥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT:

Fλ⁢(wλ⁢(t))≤F⋆+λ⁢(R1η+12⁢R2+ε).subscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡superscript𝐹⋆𝜆subscript𝑅1𝜂12superscript𝑅2𝜀F_{\lambda}(w^{\lambda}(t))\leq F^{\star}+\lambda(\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{1}{% 2}R^{2}+\varepsilon).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) ≤ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ( divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ε ) . (21)

Now define T~λ=inf{t≥t⁢(λ)λ∣uλ⁢(t)∉U}subscript~𝑇𝜆infimumconditional-set𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝑈\tilde{T}_{\lambda}=\inf\left\{t\geq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}\mid u^{\lambda}% (t)\not\in U\right\}over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_inf { italic_t ≥ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ∣ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∉ italic_U }. Since ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M minimizes F𝐹Fitalic_F on U𝑈Uitalic_U, Equation 21 implies by continuity that for any t∈[t′,T~λ]𝑡superscript𝑡′subscript~𝑇𝜆t\in[t^{\prime},\tilde{T}_{\lambda}]italic_t ∈ [ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]:

12⁢‖wλ⁢(t)‖2≤R1η+12⁢R2+ε.12superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡2subscript𝑅1𝜂12superscript𝑅2𝜀\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(t)\|^{2}\leq\frac{R_{1}}{\eta}+\frac{1}{2}R^{2}+\varepsilon.divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ divide start_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ε .

In particular, for K2=B⁢(0,2⁢R1η+R2+3⁢ε)subscript𝐾2𝐵02subscript𝑅1𝜂superscript𝑅23𝜀K_{2}=B(0,\frac{2R_{1}}{\eta}+R^{2}+3\varepsilon)italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_B ( 0 , divide start_ARG 2 italic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG + italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 3 italic_ε ) and any t∈[t′,T~λ]𝑡superscript𝑡′subscript~𝑇𝜆t\in[t^{\prime},\tilde{T}_{\lambda}]italic_t ∈ [ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], wλ⁢(t)∈K2superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡subscript𝐾2w^{\lambda}(t)\in K_{2}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. By continuity and compactness, infw∈(∂U)∩K2F⁢(w)>F⋆subscriptinfimum𝑤𝑈subscript𝐾2𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K_{2}}F(w)>F^{\star}roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ ( ∂ italic_U ) ∩ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT thanks to Lemma 5. In consequence, we can choose λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ small enough so that Equation 21 implies that for any t∈[t′,T~λ]𝑡superscript𝑡′subscript~𝑇𝜆t\in[t^{\prime},\tilde{T}_{\lambda}]italic_t ∈ [ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ],

F⁢(wλ⁢(t))<infw∈(∂U)∩K2F⁢(w).𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡subscriptinfimum𝑤𝑈subscript𝐾2𝐹𝑤\displaystyle F(w^{\lambda}(t))<\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K_{2}}F(w).italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) < roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ ( ∂ italic_U ) ∩ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) .

Assume now that T~λ<∞subscript~𝑇𝜆\tilde{T}_{\lambda}<\inftyover~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞. Since wλ⁢(T~λ)∈K2superscript𝑤𝜆subscript~𝑇𝜆subscript𝐾2w^{\lambda}(\tilde{T}_{\lambda})\in K_{2}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∈ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the previous inequality implies by continuity that wλ⁢(T~λ)∉∂Usuperscript𝑤𝜆subscript~𝑇𝜆𝑈w^{\lambda}(\tilde{T}_{\lambda})\not\in\partial Uitalic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∉ ∂ italic_U, i.e., wλ⁢(T~λ)∈Ůsuperscript𝑤𝜆subscript~𝑇𝜆̊𝑈w^{\lambda}(\tilde{T}_{\lambda})\in\mathring{U}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∈ over̊ start_ARG italic_U end_ARG. This however contradicts the definition of T~λsubscript~𝑇𝜆\tilde{T}_{\lambda}over~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so that T~λ<∞subscript~𝑇𝜆\tilde{T}_{\lambda}<\inftyover~ start_ARG italic_T end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < ∞. In particular for any t≥t′𝑡superscript𝑡′t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t ≥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, wλ⁢(t)∈K2superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡subscript𝐾2w^{\lambda}(t)\in K_{2}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.


To summarize, we have showed that there exists a small enough λ⋆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda^{\star}italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, such that for any λ<λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda<\lambda^{\star}italic_λ < italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

  1. 1.

    wλ⁢(t)superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is included in some compact K1subscript𝐾1K_{1}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for t≤t⁢(λ)λ𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆t\leq\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda}italic_t ≤ divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG;

  2. 2.

    wλ⁢(t)superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is included in B⁢(Φ⁢(w0),δ)𝐵Φsubscript𝑤0𝛿B(\Phi(w_{0}),\delta)italic_B ( roman_Φ ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_δ ) or t∈(t⁢(λ)λ,t′)𝑡𝑡𝜆𝜆superscript𝑡′t\in(\frac{t(\lambda)}{\lambda},t^{\prime})italic_t ∈ ( divide start_ARG italic_t ( italic_λ ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT );

  3. 3.

    wλ⁢(t)superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡w^{\lambda}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is included in some compact K2subscript𝐾2K_{2}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for t≥t′𝑡superscript𝑡′t\geq t^{\prime}italic_t ≥ italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT;

where K1subscript𝐾1K_{1}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and K2subscript𝐾2K_{2}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are both independent of λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ. In particular, there exists a compact K𝐾Kitalic_K of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT independent of λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ such that for any λ≤λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_λ ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, the trajectory of (wλ⁢(t))t≥0subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝑡0(w^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ≥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is included in K𝐾Kitalic_K.

For λ≥λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\geq\lambda^{\star}italic_λ ≥ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we directly have by monotonicity of the objective that for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0

12⁢‖wλ⁢(t)‖212superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡2\displaystyle\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(t)\|^{2}divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤12⁢‖wλ⁢(0)‖2+1λ⁢(F⁢(wλ⁢(0))−F⁢(wλ⁢(t)))absent12superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤𝜆021𝜆𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆0𝐹superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(0)\|^{2}+\frac{1}{\lambda}\left(F(w^% {\lambda}(0))-F(w^{\lambda}(t))\right)≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG ( italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) - italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) )
≤12∥wλ(0)∥2+1λ⋆F(wλ(0),\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{2}\|w^{\lambda}(0)\|^{2}+\frac{1}{\lambda^{\star}}F(% w^{\lambda}(0),≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_F ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ,

so that the trajectory (wλ⁢(t))t≥0subscriptsuperscript𝑤𝜆𝑡𝑡0(w^{\lambda}(t))_{t\geq 0}( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t ≥ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is also included in a compact independent of λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ.

As a consequence, the definability assumption of Fλsubscript𝐹𝜆F_{\lambda}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT along with the boundedness implies that limt→∞wλ⁢(t)subscript→𝑡superscript𝑤𝜆𝑡\lim_{t\to\infty}w^{\lambda}(t)roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) exists thanks to Kurdyka [1998, Theorem 2].

∎

B.5 Proof of Lemma 3

See 3

Proof.

We consider the neighbourhood U𝑈Uitalic_U defined as in Lemma 7. By definition, F𝐹Fitalic_F is constant on the manifold ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and denote its value F⋆superscript𝐹⋆F^{\star}italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, i.e., F⋆=supw∈ℳF⁢(w)=infw∈ℳF⁢(w)superscript𝐹⋆subscriptsupremum𝑤ℳ𝐹𝑤subscriptinfimum𝑤ℳ𝐹𝑤F^{\star}=\sup_{w\in\mathcal{M}}F(w)=\inf_{w\in\mathcal{M}}F(w)italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_sup start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) = roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ).

For any ε>0𝜀0\varepsilon>0italic_ε > 0, we define Uεsubscript𝑈𝜀U_{\varepsilon}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as Uε={w∈U∣F⁢(w)<F⋆+ε}subscript𝑈𝜀conditional-set𝑤𝑈𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆𝜀U_{\varepsilon}=\{w\in U\mid F(w)<F^{\star}+\varepsilon\}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_w ∈ italic_U ∣ italic_F ( italic_w ) < italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ε } and show that it satisfies these three conditions. By continuity of F𝐹Fitalic_F, Uεsubscript𝑈𝜀U_{\varepsilon}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a neighbourhood of ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M and the first condition is obviously satisfied.

Thanks to Lemma 5, for any w∈U∖ℳ𝑤𝑈ℳw\in U\setminus\mathcal{M}italic_w ∈ italic_U ∖ caligraphic_M, F⁢(w)>F⋆𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆F(w)>F^{\star}italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. This implies the third condition,

⋂ε>0Uε=ℳ.subscript𝜀0subscript𝑈𝜀ℳ\bigcap_{\varepsilon>0}U_{\varepsilon}=\mathcal{M}.⋂ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_M .

The arguments of Lemma 7 extend to any family of solutions (uλ)λ>0subscriptsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝜆0(u^{\lambda})_{\lambda>0}( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying the assumptions of Lemma 3. In consequence, we can consider a compact K𝐾Kitalic_K of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0 and λ>0𝜆0\lambda>0italic_λ > 0, uλ⁢(t)∈Ksuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝐾u^{\lambda}(t)\in Kitalic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ italic_K. From there, note again that infw∈(∂U)∩KF⁢(w)>F⋆subscriptinfimum𝑤𝑈𝐾𝐹𝑤superscript𝐹⋆\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K}F(w)>F^{\star}roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ ( ∂ italic_U ) ∩ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Since uλ⁢(0)→u0∈ℳ→superscript𝑢𝜆0subscript𝑢0ℳu^{\lambda}(0)\to u_{0}\in\mathcal{M}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) → italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_M, we can then choose λ⁢(ε)>0𝜆𝜀0\lambda(\varepsilon)>0italic_λ ( italic_ε ) > 0 small enough, so that for any λ∈(0,λ⁢(ε)]𝜆0𝜆𝜀\lambda\in(0,\lambda(\varepsilon)]italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , italic_λ ( italic_ε ) ],

F⁢(uλ⁢(0))+λ2⁢‖uλ⁢(0)‖22<min⁡(F⋆+ε,infw∈(∂U)∩KF⁢(w)).𝐹superscript𝑢𝜆0𝜆2subscriptsuperscriptnormsuperscript𝑢𝜆022superscript𝐹⋆𝜀subscriptinfimum𝑤𝑈𝐾𝐹𝑤F(u^{\lambda}(0))+\frac{\lambda}{2}\|u^{\lambda}(0)\|^{2}_{2}<\min(F^{\star}+% \varepsilon,\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K}F(w)).italic_F ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) + divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < roman_min ( italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ε , roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ ( ∂ italic_U ) ∩ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) ) .

By monotonicity of the objective over time, F⁢(uλ⁢(t))+λ⁢‖uλ⁢(t)‖22<min⁡(F⋆+ε,infw∈(∂U)∩KF⁢(w))𝐹superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡𝜆subscriptsuperscriptnormsuperscript𝑢𝜆𝑡22superscript𝐹⋆𝜀subscriptinfimum𝑤𝑈𝐾𝐹𝑤F(u^{\lambda}(t))+\lambda\|u^{\lambda}(t)\|^{2}_{2}<\min(F^{\star}+\varepsilon% ,\inf_{w\in(\partial U)\cap K}F(w))italic_F ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ) + italic_λ ∥ italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < roman_min ( italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ε , roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ∈ ( ∂ italic_U ) ∩ italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_w ) ) for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0. Since uλ⁢(t)superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡u^{\lambda}(t)italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is continuous, it implies that uλ⁢(t)∈Uε∘superscript𝑢𝜆𝑡subscript𝑈𝜀u^{\lambda}(t)\in\overset{\circ}{U_{\varepsilon}}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ∈ over∘ start_ARG italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ε end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0, which concludes the proof of Lemma 3. ∎

B.6 Strict Minimality

Lemma 8.

Under the same assumptions than Proposition 4 with w⋆=limt→∞w~∘⁢(t)superscript𝑤⋆subscript→𝑡superscript~𝑤𝑡w^{\star}=\lim_{t\to\infty}\tilde{w}^{\circ}(t)italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∘ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ), there exists a δ⋆>0superscript𝛿⋆0\delta^{\star}>0italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 such that for any δ∈(0,δ⋆)𝛿0superscript𝛿⋆\delta\in(0,\delta^{\star})italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), there exists ε>0𝜀0\varepsilon>0italic_ε > 0 and λ⋆>0superscript𝜆⋆0\lambda^{\star}>0italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 such that for any λ∈(0,λ⋆)𝜆0superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\in(0,\lambda^{\star})italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

inf∂B⁢(w⋆,δ)Fλ⁢(w)>F⋆+λ⁢‖w⋆‖22+λ⁢ε.subscriptinfimum𝐵superscript𝑤⋆𝛿subscript𝐹𝜆𝑤superscript𝐹⋆𝜆superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆22𝜆𝜀\inf_{\partial B(w^{\star},\delta)}F_{\lambda}(w)>F^{\star}+\lambda\frac{\|w^{% \star}\|^{2}}{2}+\lambda\varepsilon.roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∂ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ divide start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_λ italic_ε . (22)
Proof.

Let δ⋆>0superscript𝛿⋆0\delta^{\star}>0italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 be such that for any w∈ℳ∩B⁢(w⋆,2⁢δ⋆)𝑤ℳ𝐵superscript𝑤⋆2superscript𝛿⋆w\in\mathcal{M}\cap B(w^{\star},2\delta^{\star})italic_w ∈ caligraphic_M ∩ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 2 italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), w≠w⋆⟹‖w‖2>‖w⋆‖2𝑤superscript𝑤⋆superscriptnorm𝑤2superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆2w\neq w^{\star}\implies\|w\|^{2}>\|w^{\star}\|^{2}italic_w ≠ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟹ ∥ italic_w ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and such that Equation 14 holds. Now let δ∈(0,δ⋆)𝛿0superscript𝛿⋆\delta\in(0,\delta^{\star})italic_δ ∈ ( 0 , italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). We now fix λ⋆>0superscript𝜆⋆0\lambda^{\star}>0italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0 arbitrarily small, choose λ∈(0,λ⋆)𝜆0superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\in(0,\lambda^{\star})italic_λ ∈ ( 0 , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) and define

ε=14⁢infu∈ℳδ2≤‖u−w⋆‖≤2⁢δ‖u‖22−‖w⋆‖22.𝜀14subscriptinfimum𝑢ℳ𝛿2norm𝑢superscript𝑤⋆2𝛿superscriptsubscriptnorm𝑢22superscriptsubscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆22\varepsilon=\frac{1}{4}\inf_{\begin{subarray}{c}u\in\mathcal{M}\\ \frac{\delta}{2}\leq\|u-w^{\star}\|\leq 2\delta\end{subarray}}\|u\|_{2}^{2}-\|% w^{\star}\|_{2}^{2}.italic_ε = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG roman_inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_u ∈ caligraphic_M end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ≤ ∥ italic_u - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ 2 italic_δ end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_u ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

By strict minimality, compactness and continuity, ε>0𝜀0\varepsilon>0italic_ε > 0.

Let now w∈∂B⁢(w⋆,δ)𝑤𝐵superscript𝑤⋆𝛿w\in\partial B(w^{\star},\delta)italic_w ∈ ∂ italic_B ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_δ ). We can decompose w𝑤witalic_w as w=u+v𝑤𝑢𝑣w=u+vitalic_w = italic_u + italic_v, where u∈arg⁢minw′∈ℳ⁢‖w−w′‖𝑢argsubscriptminsuperscript𝑤′ℳnorm𝑤superscript𝑤′u\in\mathrm{arg\ min\ }_{w^{\prime}\in\mathcal{M}}\|w-w^{\prime}\|italic_u ∈ roman_arg roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ caligraphic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_w - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥. Necessarily, ‖v‖=d⁢(w,ℳ)≤δnorm𝑣𝑑𝑤ℳ𝛿\|v\|=d(w,\mathcal{M})\leq\delta∥ italic_v ∥ = italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ) ≤ italic_δ and ‖w−w⋆‖=δnorm𝑤superscript𝑤⋆𝛿\|w-w^{\star}\|=\delta∥ italic_w - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ = italic_δ. In particular, we also have 2⁢δ≥‖u−w⋆‖≥δ−‖v‖2𝛿norm𝑢superscript𝑤⋆𝛿norm𝑣2\delta\geq\|u-w^{\star}\|\geq\delta-\|v\|2 italic_δ ≥ ∥ italic_u - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≥ italic_δ - ∥ italic_v ∥. From there, using the quadratic growth property (Equation 14):

Fλ⁢(w)subscript𝐹𝜆𝑤\displaystyle F_{\lambda}(w)italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) ≥F⁢(w)+λ2⁢(‖u‖−‖v‖)2absent𝐹𝑤𝜆2superscriptnorm𝑢norm𝑣2\displaystyle\geq F(w)+\frac{\lambda}{2}(\|u\|-\|v\|)^{2}≥ italic_F ( italic_w ) + divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( ∥ italic_u ∥ - ∥ italic_v ∥ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
≥F⋆+η4⁢d⁢(w,ℳ)2+λ2⁢(‖u‖2−2⁢‖u‖⁢‖v‖)absentsuperscript𝐹⋆𝜂4𝑑superscript𝑤ℳ2𝜆2superscriptnorm𝑢22norm𝑢norm𝑣\displaystyle\geq F^{\star}+\frac{\eta}{4}d(w,\mathcal{M})^{2}+\frac{\lambda}{% 2}(\|u\|^{2}-2\|u\|\|v\|)≥ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( ∥ italic_u ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 2 ∥ italic_u ∥ ∥ italic_v ∥ )
≥Fλ⁢(w⋆)+η4⁢d⁢(w,ℳ)2−λ⁢(‖w⋆‖+2⁢δ)⁢‖v‖+λ2⁢(‖u‖2−‖w⋆‖2).absentsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤⋆𝜂4𝑑superscript𝑤ℳ2𝜆normsuperscript𝑤⋆2𝛿norm𝑣𝜆2superscriptnorm𝑢2superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆2\displaystyle\geq F_{\lambda}(w^{\star})+\frac{\eta}{4}d(w,\mathcal{M})^{2}-% \lambda(\|w^{\star}\|+2\delta)\|v\|+\frac{\lambda}{2}(\|u\|^{2}-\|w^{\star}\|^% {2}).≥ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG italic_d ( italic_w , caligraphic_M ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_λ ( ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ + 2 italic_δ ) ∥ italic_v ∥ + divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( ∥ italic_u ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

Let c⁢(ε,δ)=min⁡(δ2;ε‖w⋆‖+2⁢δ)>0𝑐𝜀𝛿𝛿2𝜀normsuperscript𝑤⋆2𝛿0c(\varepsilon,\delta)=\min(\frac{\delta}{2};\frac{\varepsilon}{\|w^{\star}\|+2% \delta})>0italic_c ( italic_ε , italic_δ ) = roman_min ( divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ; divide start_ARG italic_ε end_ARG start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ + 2 italic_δ end_ARG ) > 0. There are two cases.

1) Either ‖v‖≤c⁢(ε,δ)norm𝑣𝑐𝜀𝛿\|v\|\leq c(\varepsilon,\delta)∥ italic_v ∥ ≤ italic_c ( italic_ε , italic_δ ), in which case 2⁢δ≥‖u−w⋆‖≥δ22𝛿norm𝑢superscript𝑤⋆𝛿22\delta\geq\|u-w^{\star}\|\geq\frac{\delta}{2}2 italic_δ ≥ ∥ italic_u - italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≥ divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG, so that by definition of ε𝜀\varepsilonitalic_ε

Fλ⁢(w)subscript𝐹𝜆𝑤\displaystyle F_{\lambda}(w)italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) ≥Fλ⁢(w⋆)−λ⁢(‖w⋆‖+2⁢δ)⁢‖v‖+λ2⁢(‖u‖2−‖w⋆‖2)absentsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤⋆𝜆normsuperscript𝑤⋆2𝛿norm𝑣𝜆2superscriptnorm𝑢2superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆2\displaystyle\geq F_{\lambda}(w^{\star})-\lambda(\|w^{\star}\|+2\delta)\|v\|+% \frac{\lambda}{2}(\|u\|^{2}-\|w^{\star}\|^{2})≥ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_λ ( ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ + 2 italic_δ ) ∥ italic_v ∥ + divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( ∥ italic_u ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
≥Fλ⁢(w⋆)−λ⁢(‖w⋆‖+2⁢δ)⁢c⁢(ε,δ)+λ2⋅4⁢εabsentsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤⋆𝜆normsuperscript𝑤⋆2𝛿𝑐𝜀𝛿⋅𝜆24𝜀\displaystyle\geq F_{\lambda}(w^{\star})-\lambda(\|w^{\star}\|+2\delta)c(% \varepsilon,\delta)+\frac{\lambda}{2}\cdot 4\varepsilon≥ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_λ ( ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ + 2 italic_δ ) italic_c ( italic_ε , italic_δ ) + divide start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ⋅ 4 italic_ε
≥Fλ⁢(w⋆)+λ⁢ε.absentsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤⋆𝜆𝜀\displaystyle\geq F_{\lambda}(w^{\star})+\lambda\varepsilon.≥ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_λ italic_ε .

2) Or ‖v‖≥c⁢(ε,δ)norm𝑣𝑐𝜀𝛿\|v\|\geq c(\varepsilon,\delta)∥ italic_v ∥ ≥ italic_c ( italic_ε , italic_δ ), in which case we simply have, also using that ‖v‖≤δnorm𝑣𝛿\|v\|\leq\delta∥ italic_v ∥ ≤ italic_δ:

Fλ⁢(w)subscript𝐹𝜆𝑤\displaystyle F_{\lambda}(w)italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) ≥Fλ⁢(w⋆)+η4⁢‖v‖2−λ⁢(‖w⋆‖+2⁢δ)⁢‖v‖absentsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤⋆𝜂4superscriptnorm𝑣2𝜆normsuperscript𝑤⋆2𝛿norm𝑣\displaystyle\geq F_{\lambda}(w^{\star})+\frac{\eta}{4}\|v\|^{2}-\lambda(\|w^{% \star}\|+2\delta)\|v\|≥ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG ∥ italic_v ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_λ ( ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ + 2 italic_δ ) ∥ italic_v ∥
≥Fλ⁢(w⋆)+η4⁢c⁢(ε,δ)2−λ⁢(‖w⋆‖+2⁢δ)⁢δ.absentsubscript𝐹𝜆superscript𝑤⋆𝜂4𝑐superscript𝜀𝛿2𝜆normsuperscript𝑤⋆2𝛿𝛿\displaystyle\geq F_{\lambda}(w^{\star})+\frac{\eta}{4}c(\varepsilon,\delta)^{% 2}-\lambda(\|w^{\star}\|+2\delta)\delta.≥ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG italic_c ( italic_ε , italic_δ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_λ ( ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ + 2 italic_δ ) italic_δ .

In particular, choosing λ⋆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda^{\star}italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT small enough – depending on η,ε𝜂𝜀\eta,\varepsilonitalic_η , italic_ε and δ𝛿\deltaitalic_δ – we have for any λ≤λ⋆𝜆superscript𝜆⋆\lambda\leq\lambda^{\star}italic_λ ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT that

η4⁢c⁢(ε,δ)2−λ⁢(‖w⋆‖+2⁢δ)⁢δ≥λ⁢ε.𝜂4𝑐superscript𝜀𝛿2𝜆normsuperscript𝑤⋆2𝛿𝛿𝜆𝜀\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{4}c(\varepsilon,\delta)^{2}-\lambda(\|w^{\star}\|+2% \delta)\delta\geq\lambda\varepsilon.divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 4 end_ARG italic_c ( italic_ε , italic_δ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_λ ( ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ + 2 italic_δ ) italic_δ ≥ italic_λ italic_ε .

So that in both cases, Fλ⁢(w)>F⋆+λ⁢‖w⋆‖22+λ⁢εsubscript𝐹𝜆𝑤superscript𝐹⋆𝜆superscriptnormsuperscript𝑤⋆22𝜆𝜀F_{\lambda}(w)>F^{\star}+\lambda\frac{\|w^{\star}\|^{2}}{2}+\lambda\varepsilonitalic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w ) > italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ divide start_ARG ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + italic_λ italic_ε. ∎

Appendix C Applications

In this section, we provide additional details to the examples discussed in Section 5, and specify how our theoretical results can be applied in various settings.

Linear regression.

We consider F⁢(w)=‖X⁢w−y‖22𝐹𝑤superscriptsubscriptnorm𝑋𝑤𝑦22F(w)=\|Xw-y\|_{2}^{2}italic_F ( italic_w ) = ∥ italic_X italic_w - italic_y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with X∈ℝn×d𝑋superscriptℝ𝑛𝑑X\in\mathbb{R}^{n\times d}italic_X ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and n≤d𝑛𝑑n\leq ditalic_n ≤ italic_d; assume for simplicity that X𝑋Xitalic_X is full rank. In this setting, the dynamics can be computed explicitely to illustrate our result.

Denote the solution of minimal ℓ2subscriptℓ2\ell_{2}roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT norm with w⋆=X+⁢ysuperscript𝑤⋆superscript𝑋𝑦w^{\star}=X^{+}yitalic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_y, where X+superscript𝑋X^{+}italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse of X𝑋Xitalic_X. The problem is convex and the critical set of F𝐹Fitalic_F is the affine subspace ℳ=w⋆+Ker⁢(X)ℳsuperscript𝑤⋆Ker𝑋\mathcal{M}=w^{\star}+\mathrm{Ker}(X)caligraphic_M = italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + roman_Ker ( italic_X ), which is a manifold: Assumption 2 is satisfied.

Consider the singular value decomposition X=U⁢Σ⁢V⊤𝑋𝑈Σsuperscript𝑉topX=U\Sigma V^{\top}italic_X = italic_U roman_Σ italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT where U∈ℝn×d,V∈ℝd×dformulae-sequence𝑈superscriptℝ𝑛𝑑𝑉superscriptℝ𝑑𝑑U\in\mathbb{R}^{n\times d},V\in\mathbb{R}^{d\times d}italic_U ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_V ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d × italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are orthogonal and Σ=diag⁢(σ1,…,σd)Σdiagsubscript𝜎1…subscript𝜎𝑑\Sigma=\mathrm{diag}(\sigma_{1},\dots,\sigma_{d})roman_Σ = roman_diag ( italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with σn+1=⋯=σd=0subscript𝜎𝑛1⋯subscript𝜎𝑑0\sigma_{n+1}=\dots=\sigma_{d}=0italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ⋯ = italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0. We make the change of coordinates z=V⊤⁢w𝑧superscript𝑉top𝑤z=V^{\top}witalic_z = italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w, and notice that in this basis the minimum norm solution z⋆=V⊤⁢w⋆superscript𝑧⋆superscript𝑉topsuperscript𝑤⋆z^{\star}=V^{\top}w^{\star}italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is of the form z⋆=(z1⋆,…⁢zn⋆,0,…,0)superscript𝑧⋆subscriptsuperscript𝑧⋆1…subscriptsuperscript𝑧⋆𝑛0…0z^{\star}=(z^{\star}_{1},\dots z^{\star}_{n},0,\dots,0)italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 0 , … , 0 ). Then, we can compute the trajectory of the gradient flow on Fλsubscript𝐹𝜆F_{\lambda}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT initialized at z⁢(0)=V⊤⁢w0𝑧0superscript𝑉topsubscript𝑤0z(0)=V^{\top}w_{0}italic_z ( 0 ) = italic_V start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT:

  • •

    for 1≤i≤n1𝑖𝑛1\leq i\leq n1 ≤ italic_i ≤ italic_n,

    ziλ⁢(t)=ziλ,∞+e−(σi2+λ)⁢t⁢(zi⁢(0)−ziλ,∞)withziλ,∞=σi2σi2+λ⁢zi⋆,formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝑧𝑖𝜆𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑖𝜆superscript𝑒superscriptsubscript𝜎𝑖2𝜆𝑡subscript𝑧𝑖0superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑖𝜆withsuperscriptsubscript𝑧𝑖𝜆superscriptsubscript𝜎𝑖2superscriptsubscript𝜎𝑖2𝜆subscriptsuperscript𝑧⋆𝑖z_{i}^{\lambda}(t)=z_{i}^{\lambda,\infty}+e^{-(\sigma_{i}^{2}+\lambda)t}\left(% z_{i}(0)-z_{i}^{\lambda,\infty}\right)\quad\text{with}\quad z_{i}^{\lambda,% \infty}=\frac{\sigma_{i}^{2}}{\sigma_{i}^{2}+\lambda}z^{\star}_{i},italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ , ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ ) italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) - italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ , ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) with italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ , ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_λ end_ARG italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (23)
  • •

    for (n+1)≤i≤d𝑛1𝑖𝑑(n+1)\leq i\leq d( italic_n + 1 ) ≤ italic_i ≤ italic_d,

    ziλ⁢(t)=e−λ⁢t⁢zi⁢(0).superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑖𝜆𝑡superscript𝑒𝜆𝑡subscript𝑧𝑖0z_{i}^{\lambda}(t)=e^{-\lambda t}z_{i}(0).italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_λ italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) . (24)

Eq. (23) describes the dynamics along the directions orthogonal to ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M, and Eq. (24) along those parallel to ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M. When λ→0→𝜆0\lambda\rightarrow 0italic_λ → 0, the first is much faster than the second. In the first phase, the iterates converge to (z1λ,∞,…⁢znλ,∞,zn+1⁢(0),…,zd⁢(0))≈λ→0(z1⋆,…⁢zn⋆,zn+1⁢(0),…,zd⁢(0))superscript→𝜆0superscriptsubscript𝑧1𝜆…superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑛𝜆subscript𝑧𝑛10…subscript𝑧𝑑0superscriptsubscript𝑧1⋆…superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑛⋆subscript𝑧𝑛10…subscript𝑧𝑑0(z_{1}^{\lambda,\infty},\dots z_{n}^{\lambda,\infty},z_{n+1}(0),\dots,z_{d}(0)% )\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\lambda\rightarrow 0}}{{\approx}}(z_{1}^{\star},\dots z% _{n}^{\star},z_{n+1}(0),\dots,z_{d}(0))( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ , ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ , ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) , … , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) ) start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG ≈ end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ → 0 end_ARG end_RELOP ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) , … , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) ); this is the limit of unregularised gradient flow zGFsuperscript𝑧GFz^{\rm GF}italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (which is also here the projection of the initial point onto ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M). In the second phase, the iterates converge slowly towards the mimimum norm solution (z1⋆,…⁢zn⋆,0,…,0)superscriptsubscript𝑧1⋆…superscriptsubscript𝑧𝑛⋆0…0(z_{1}^{\star},\dots z_{n}^{\star},0,\dots,0)( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , … italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⋆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 , … , 0 ).

Diagonal linear networks (DLNs).

DLNs serve as a toy example to understand the influence of the architecture on the training dynamics of neural networks [Pesme, 2024]. The corresponding optimization problem writes

min(w1,w2)∈ℝ2⁢d⁡‖X⁢(w1⊙w2)−y‖22,subscriptsubscript𝑤1subscript𝑤2superscriptℝ2𝑑superscriptsubscriptnorm𝑋direct-productsubscript𝑤1subscript𝑤2𝑦22\min_{(w_{1},w_{2})\in\mathbb{R}^{2d}}\|X(w_{1}\odot w_{2})-y\|_{2}^{2},roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_X ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊙ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where ⊙direct-product\odot⊙ denotes the componentwise product, and X∈ℝn×d𝑋superscriptℝ𝑛𝑑X\in\mathbb{R}^{n\times d}italic_X ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the feature matrix with n≤d𝑛𝑑n\leq ditalic_n ≤ italic_d, which we assume to be full rank. It is usually convenient to perform a rotation of the coordinates and rewrite the problem as

min(u,v)∈ℝ2⁢d⁡F⁢(u,v)=‖X⁢(u2−v2)−y‖22,subscript𝑢𝑣superscriptℝ2𝑑𝐹𝑢𝑣superscriptsubscriptnorm𝑋superscript𝑢2superscript𝑣2𝑦22\min_{(u,v)\in\mathbb{R}^{2d}}F(u,v)=\|X(u^{2}-v^{2})-y\|_{2}^{2},roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_u , italic_v ) ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_u , italic_v ) = ∥ italic_X ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where u2,v2superscript𝑢2superscript𝑣2u^{2},v^{2}italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT denotes the componentwise square. The critical set of F𝐹Fitalic_F is composed of the couples (u,v)𝑢𝑣(u,v)( italic_u , italic_v ) satisfying

u⊙v⊙[X⊤⁢(X⁢(u2−v2)−y)]=0,direct-product𝑢𝑣delimited-[]superscript𝑋top𝑋superscript𝑢2superscript𝑣2𝑦0u\odot v\odot\left[X^{\top}(X(u^{2}-v^{2})-y)\right]=0,\\ italic_u ⊙ italic_v ⊙ [ italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X ( italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_y ) ] = 0 , (25)

This set has singularities for points who have null coordinates; if we exclude those problematic points, we can show that it is a manifold.

Proposition 5.

The set ℳ∗=∇F−1⁢(0)∩(ℝ∗)2⁢dsuperscriptℳ∇superscript𝐹10superscriptsuperscriptℝ2𝑑\mathcal{M}^{*}=\nabla F^{-1}(0)\cap(\mathbb{R}^{*})^{2d}caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∇ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ∩ ( blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a smooth manifold of dimension 2⁢d−n2𝑑𝑛2d-n2 italic_d - italic_n.

Proof.

Let (u¯,v¯)∈ℳ∗¯𝑢¯𝑣superscriptℳ(\bar{u},\bar{v})\in\mathcal{M}^{*}( over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG , over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ) ∈ caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Denote W𝑊Witalic_W a neighborhood of (u¯,v¯)¯𝑢¯𝑣(\bar{u},\bar{v})( over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG , over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ) such that U⊂(ℝ∗)2⁢d𝑈superscriptsuperscriptℝ2𝑑U\subset(\mathbb{R}^{*})^{2d}italic_U ⊂ ( blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The function H:ℝ2⁢d→Rd:𝐻→superscriptℝ2𝑑superscript𝑅𝑑H:\mathbb{R}^{2d}\rightarrow R^{d}italic_H : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with H⁢(u,v)=X⊤⁢(X⁢(u⊙v)−y)𝐻𝑢𝑣superscript𝑋top𝑋direct-product𝑢𝑣𝑦H(u,v)=X^{\top}(X(u\odot v)-y)italic_H ( italic_u , italic_v ) = italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X ( italic_u ⊙ italic_v ) - italic_y ) is a local defining function for ℳ∗superscriptℳ\mathcal{M}^{*}caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, in the sense that for (u,v)∈W𝑢𝑣𝑊(u,v)\in W( italic_u , italic_v ) ∈ italic_W, we have (u,v)∈ℳ∗⇔H⁢(u,v)=0iff𝑢𝑣superscriptℳ𝐻𝑢𝑣0(u,v)\in\mathcal{M}^{*}\iff H(u,v)=0( italic_u , italic_v ) ∈ caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⇔ italic_H ( italic_u , italic_v ) = 0.

The differential of H𝐻Hitalic_H at (u¯,v¯)¯𝑢¯𝑣(\bar{u},\bar{v})( over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG , over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ) is the linear map satisfying for (Δ⁢u,Δ⁢v)∈ℝ2⁢dΔ𝑢Δ𝑣superscriptℝ2𝑑(\Delta u,\Delta v)\in\mathbb{R}^{2d}( roman_Δ italic_u , roman_Δ italic_v ) ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

D⁢H⁢(u¯,v¯)⁢[Δ⁢u,Δ⁢v]=2⁢X⊤⁢X⁢(u¯⊙Δ⁢u−v¯⊙Δ⁢v).𝐷𝐻¯𝑢¯𝑣Δ𝑢Δ𝑣2superscript𝑋top𝑋direct-product¯𝑢Δ𝑢direct-product¯𝑣Δ𝑣DH(\bar{u},\bar{v})[\Delta u,\Delta v]=2X^{\top}X(\bar{u}\odot\Delta u-\bar{v}% \odot\Delta v).italic_D italic_H ( over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG , over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ) [ roman_Δ italic_u , roman_Δ italic_v ] = 2 italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_X ( over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG ⊙ roman_Δ italic_u - over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ⊙ roman_Δ italic_v ) .

It is clear that, since all coordinates of (u¯,v¯)¯𝑢¯𝑣(\bar{u},\bar{v})( over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG , over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ) are nonzero, the map (Δ⁢u,Δ⁢v)↦u¯⊙Δ⁢u−v¯⊙Δ⁢vmaps-toΔ𝑢Δ𝑣direct-product¯𝑢Δ𝑢direct-product¯𝑣Δ𝑣(\Delta u,\Delta v)\mapsto\bar{u}\odot\Delta u-\bar{v}\odot\Delta v( roman_Δ italic_u , roman_Δ italic_v ) ↦ over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG ⊙ roman_Δ italic_u - over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ⊙ roman_Δ italic_v is a surjection on ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and therefore rank⁢(D⁢H⁢(u¯,v¯))=rank⁢(X⊤⁢X)=nrank𝐷𝐻¯𝑢¯𝑣ranksuperscript𝑋top𝑋𝑛\text{rank}(DH(\bar{u},\bar{v}))=\text{rank}(X^{\top}X)=nrank ( italic_D italic_H ( over¯ start_ARG italic_u end_ARG , over¯ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ) ) = rank ( italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_X ) = italic_n. This proves that ℳ∗superscriptℳ\mathcal{M}^{*}caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a manifold of dimension 2⁢d−n2𝑑𝑛2d-n2 italic_d - italic_n [Boumal, 2023, §3.2]. ∎

Because of the singular points in ℳℳ\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M, the function F𝐹Fitalic_F does not satisfy Assumption 2 globally. However, our results can still be applied locally: see the paragraph below for details.

Noting that, for a vector w∈ℝd𝑤superscriptℝ𝑑w\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_w ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have

‖w‖1=minu,v∈ℝd⁡‖u‖22+‖v‖22⁢subject to ⁢u2−v2=w,subscriptnorm𝑤1subscript𝑢𝑣superscriptℝ𝑑superscriptsubscriptnorm𝑢22superscriptsubscriptnorm𝑣22subject to superscript𝑢2superscript𝑣2𝑤\|w\|_{1}=\min_{u,v\in\mathbb{R}^{d}}\|u\|_{2}^{2}+\|v\|_{2}^{2}\;\;\text{% subject to }\;u^{2}-v^{2}=w,∥ italic_w ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u , italic_v ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ italic_u ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ italic_v ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT subject to italic_u start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_w ,

we conclude that in the second, slow phase of the dynamics, the Riemannian gradient flow which minimizes ‖u‖2+‖v‖2superscriptnorm𝑢2superscriptnorm𝑣2\|u\|^{2}+\|v\|^{2}∥ italic_u ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ italic_v ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT on ℳ∗superscriptℳ\mathcal{M}^{*}caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT tends to drift towards solutions of low ℓ1subscriptℓ1\ell_{1}roman_ℓ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT norm.

Low-rank matrix sensing/completion.

Let 𝒜:𝕊n→ℝm:𝒜→superscript𝕊𝑛superscriptℝ𝑚\mathcal{A}:\mathbb{S}^{n}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{m}caligraphic_A : blackboard_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be a linear map on symmetric matrices with m≤n2𝑚superscript𝑛2m\leq n^{2}italic_m ≤ italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and y∈ℝm𝑦superscriptℝ𝑚y\in\mathbb{R}^{m}italic_y ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For a given target rank r≤n𝑟𝑛r\leq nitalic_r ≤ italic_n, the matrix sensing problem is

minW∈ℝn×r⁡F⁢(W)=‖𝒜⁢(W⁢W⊤)−y‖22subscript𝑊superscriptℝ𝑛𝑟𝐹𝑊superscriptsubscriptnorm𝒜𝑊superscript𝑊top𝑦22\min_{W\in\mathbb{R}^{n\times r}}F(W)=\|\mathcal{A}(WW^{\top})-y\|_{2}^{2}roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_r end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_W ) = ∥ caligraphic_A ( italic_W italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_y ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (26)

A typical example is symmetric matrix completion, where the goal is to recover an unknown matrix M∗∈ℝn×nsuperscript𝑀superscriptℝ𝑛𝑛M^{*}\in\mathbb{R}^{n\times n}italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT from a subset of observed entries with coefficients in Ω∈{1⁢…⁢n}2Ωsuperscript1…𝑛2\Omega\in\{1\dots n\}^{2}roman_Ω ∈ { 1 … italic_n } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT: the objective function writes F⁢(W)=∑(i,j)∈Ω((W⁢W⊤)i⁢j−Mi⁢j∗)2𝐹𝑊subscript𝑖𝑗Ωsuperscriptsubscript𝑊superscript𝑊top𝑖𝑗superscriptsubscript𝑀𝑖𝑗2F(W)=\sum_{(i,j)\in\Omega}\left((WW^{\top})_{ij}-M_{ij}^{*}\right)^{2}italic_F ( italic_W ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_i , italic_j ) ∈ roman_Ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ( italic_W italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Note that the asymmetric case presented in Section 5, Equation 8, can also be written as a symmetric matrix completion problem, by setting

W=[UV]∈ℝ(n+m)×r,𝑊matrix𝑈𝑉superscriptℝ𝑛𝑚𝑟W=\begin{bmatrix}U\\ V\end{bmatrix}\in\mathbb{R}^{(n+m)\times r},italic_W = [ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_U end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_V end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n + italic_m ) × italic_r end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

and choosing a new mask ΩΩ\Omegaroman_Ω that selects only the off-diagonal blocks of W⁢W⊤𝑊superscript𝑊topWW^{\top}italic_W italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Usually, one looks for a low-rank solution to Problem (26), by setting r𝑟ritalic_r to a small value. Here, we choose to rather study the overparameterised setting where r=n𝑟𝑛r=nitalic_r = italic_n. Our results imply that, even though we do not explicitly impose a low rank structure, the gradient flow trajectories Wλsuperscript𝑊𝜆W^{\lambda}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are driven towards a low-rank solution in the second phase of the dynamics.

Similarly to the example of diagonal linear networks, we show that, in the overparameterised setting, the critical set of F𝐹Fitalic_F is a manifold if we exclude singular matrices.

Proposition 6.

Let F𝐹Fitalic_F be the matrix sensing function defined in (26), and denote ℝ∗n×nsubscriptsuperscriptℝ𝑛𝑛\mathbb{R}^{n\times n}_{*}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the set of invertible matrices of size n×n𝑛𝑛n\times nitalic_n × italic_n. If r=n𝑟𝑛r=nitalic_r = italic_n, the set ℳ∗=∇F−1⁢(0)∩ℝ∗n×nsuperscriptℳ∇superscript𝐹10subscriptsuperscriptℝ𝑛𝑛\mathcal{M}^{*}=\nabla F^{-1}(0)\cap\mathbb{R}^{n\times n}_{*}caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∇ italic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) ∩ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a smooth manifold.

Proof.

The gradient of F𝐹Fitalic_F is

∇F⁢(W)=4⁢𝒜∗⁢(𝒜⁢(W⁢W⊤)−y)⁢W,∀W∈ℝn×n,formulae-sequence∇𝐹𝑊4superscript𝒜𝒜𝑊superscript𝑊top𝑦𝑊for-all𝑊superscriptℝ𝑛𝑛\nabla F(W)=4\mathcal{A}^{*}\left(\mathcal{A}(WW^{\top})-y\right)W,\quad% \forall W\in\mathbb{R}^{n\times n},∇ italic_F ( italic_W ) = 4 caligraphic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( caligraphic_A ( italic_W italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_y ) italic_W , ∀ italic_W ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

where 𝒜∗:ℝm→𝕊n:superscript𝒜→superscriptℝ𝑚superscript𝕊𝑛\mathcal{A}^{*}:\mathbb{R}^{m}\to\mathbb{S}^{n}caligraphic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT → blackboard_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the adjoint of 𝒜𝒜\mathcal{A}caligraphic_A.

Let W¯∈ℳ∗¯𝑊superscriptℳ\overline{W}\in\mathcal{M}^{*}over¯ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG ∈ caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and let 𝒰𝒰\mathcal{U}caligraphic_U a neighborhood of W¯¯𝑊\overline{W}over¯ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG such that 𝒰⊂ℝ∗n×n𝒰subscriptsuperscriptℝ𝑛𝑛\mathcal{U}\subset\mathbb{R}^{n\times n}_{*}caligraphic_U ⊂ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n × italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.
